texts.text: You wake up in your wreck of a boat. The waters around here are dangerous and you barely made it to the island. Dazed, you nearly forget what brought you here. Searching around the wreck would be a good start.
At any time, you can open the menu to check inputs, change options, or leave the area.

Press the menu button to open the menu.
Close it by pressing the same button again.
Use the left thumbstick to move around, and use the right stick to turn.

You are capable of using Telekinesis Sorcery.
Extend your hand towards the weapon until the highlighter shows, then press the grab button to lift it.
Now press the trigger to pull the weapon towards you.

Everything is driven by physical forces.
Defeat your enemies in your prefered fighting style - with brutality or precision. Either will do.
To run, mimic a running motion with your  hands while moving forward.

Jump by pressing the right thumbstick/touchpad or by pushing the thumbstick up.
The longer you press it, the higher you will jump.
You can use ledges or the cracks in-between rocks to climb by holding the grab button.

You can jump down or take the path down.
Jumping down is faster, but may make you feel dizzy.

Fast movements can cause nausea.
Do not hesitate to take regular breaks if you feel queazy: 
With practice in VR, this feeling should disappear.
You can wall-jump while gripping any surface by looking in the direction you wish to leap and pressing the jump button.

You have 4 holsters on you to carry weapons, two on your shoulders and two on your hips.
To store a weapon, move it over a holster and release the grab button when the highlighter shows.
To retrieve your weapon,  reach over the holster you stored it in and hold the grab button.
To open your inventory, place your hand to your chest, then press the grab trigger.
To store items and loot in your inventory, you can directly drop them on your chest.
You can get and store items in your inventory, a Dalgarian device of infinite storage capacity placed on your chest. Open it by grabbing it with your hand.
To propel yourself through water, mimic a swimming motion with your arms.
When holding onto a ledge you want to climb over, hold Jump and move forward to push yourself upwards. You can also push your arms downwards for extra momentum.
Move down the Turn Stick to crouch. When crouching you are more silent, allowing you to sneak past enemies or use stealth attacks without being noticed.
You can use telekinesis to push objects you're grabbing away from you by pressing the push button. Use this ability to open the trapdoor above.
To slide down the rope, grab it and hold the trigger button.
You can slide down ziplines with a Zipline wheel or any object you can hang on that may slide on the line.

Your item book contains two tabs: The Stash tab displays all the items you purchased or stored. You can spawn them at any time. The Home tab displays all the items that are present somewhere in your home level. You may store them in the stash at any time.
Check your spells by holding the spell wheel button on your controller.
Select a spell by releasing the spell wheel button while your hand is hovering over the spell you want. To unselect spells release the button while your hand is over an empty space
You can equip clothes or armor piece when looking at a mirror. You will find one in the shop and in your house.

To equip clothes or armor pieces, hold them over the correct body part while looking in the mirror. When the body part is highlighted, release the trigger to equip it. You can swap armor pieces and clothes this way too.
Remove equipped quivers by pressing down the trigger button and then the grip button to grab it.
Get ready for the next wave...

Prepare to fight!
Take a weapon or raise your fist to begin.

You have been rewarded.
Add it to your inventory to return home.
The difficulty level of enemies in the dungeon.
How many rooms will be generated in this dungeon.

Check this if you don't want to see any rooms where you are forced to climb in order to reach the exit.
(will reduce the dungeon diversity)
Play with relaxed damage, allowing you to let loose and not worry as much about avoiding hits.
Balanced difficulty for those that want a challenge with meaningful growth.
Downright unfair. You are weaker while enemies are more durable. Lose half of your gold when you die.
Normal difficulty, but with a twist. If you die, your character is gone for good.
Don’t forget to check the options menu and adjust the settings to your preferences.
You can slide your grip on weapons with long handles, or ropes, by holding trigger.
Remove quivers by pressing down the trigger button and then the grip button to grab it.
When grabbing a climbable surface or object, you can jump. This is helpful for mounting ledges.
You can sprint by moving your hands as if you were running.
Holding the jump button down will make you jump higher than if you tap it.
In Sandbox Mode, you can fight enemies of your choice in a variety of combat arenas or dungeon rooms, as well as start with all weapons, armor and sorcery.
Enemies are easier to knock over if they are staggered from attacks, unaware of you, or are doing an attack. Hitting enemies in the head or legs is especially effective.
Higher tier weapons fair better against stronger armors, as well as retain imbued magic for longer.
Piercing a sword entirely through an enemy’s body will cause much more damage than shallow stabs.
Enemies with plate armor are more difficult to knock over, even with spells.
Taking a blow to your arms or legs will be vastly less damaging than if you take damage to your head or torso. With no other choice, you may want to consider how you will take damage.
Projectiles can be a big problem as you fight tougher enemies. Certain abilities, using shields, and staying vigilant will save your life.
Dismembering enemies requires a skillful cut along the joints of limbs, or their neck. Steady striking speed and good edge alignment will help, as well as the right weapon.
The longer your weapon is, the smoother you should swing with it. Attempting to swing fast with a big weapon will have poor results.
Axes have strong penetrative power against soft armors like leather and chain.
Daggers can be somewhat weak, but with stabs, daggers can penetrate soft armor very easily, as well as target weak points easily. They also deal more damage when thrown!
Maces are weak against soft armors like leather and chain mail, but are quite effective against flesh and plate armor.
Enemies don’t carry many arrows, but quivers that you buy will contain a lot more. Higher tiered quivers carry even more arrows.
Each piece of protective armor that is equipped will have a negative impact on your focus recovery, spell casting speed, and sprinting speed, but will provide physical protection.

Wearing most clothing (or no clothing at all) grants neither benefit, nor penalty. However, Sorcerer clothing increases spell casting speed, but also incurs a focus regain penalty. Consider your combat style carefully when choosing armor!
Some items can be imbued with the hand you hold it in, such as some shields and the throwing knife. Your bow hand can be used to imbue arrows as well.
The Dalgarians were an ancient civilization, well versed in Sorcery, that have left behind vast and mysterious ruins. These ruins have recently become of great interest to factions all around Eraden.
The Outlaws are a semi-organized group hunted by the Eraden Kingdom for their relentless searching and partaking of crystals; their one goal that sustains their organization.
The Wildfolk are a tribe invading Eraden territory. They have ancient beliefs related to the Dalgarian ruins found throughout Eraden, causing them to clash with local powers.
The Eraden Kingdom rules over the land of Eraden. They seek to contain and control the unrelenting spread of sorcery within their kingdom though any means necessary.
The Eye are a mysterious and elusive faction that has wholly embraced the practice of sorcery and wish to restore sorcery to the glory of ancient times.
Holding an imbued staff boosts the charge speed and effectiveness of that spell in your other hand.
Repelling Burst can be used to propel yourself into the air... but watch your health!
You can stay in Hyperfocus for a significantly longer duration while inside Dilation Bubble. Use this to set up thrown weapon traps for your helpless foes!
Your strength is massively increased while in Hyperfocus. Climbing, throwing, punching and blunt weapons are all extremely effective.
Boost Jump has diminishing returns for each boost you do before touching the ground. Make sure you can make that jump!
Molten Arc can be used on arrows and thrown weapons to follow up your ranged attack with a spray of sparks.
Telespin a weapon imbued with Molten Arc to create a portable shower of igniting embers!
Combining Boost Jump, Weightless Boost and Precision Focus allows you to fire arrows from above with impunity.
Struggling against shields? Heavy Firepower, Weapon Theft and Static Disarm allow you to disarm your enemies - or stab straight through them with a Fire-imbued weapon!
Combining the strength increase from Second Wind with Martial Protege allows you to tear off enemy limbs with ease!
Thunderbolt benefits from Charge Sapping! Sapping Lightning increases the range of the bolt, while Gravity and Fire inflict their respective statuses on the hit enemy and everyone around them!
The strength increase while in Hyperfocus makes Force Punch and Rocket Punch much more effective!
Combine Conflagration, Ignition Burst and Fan the Flames to spread fire to all your foes - then use Detonation Swarm to obliterate them with homing fireballs!
Impact Pulse is much more effective when used on heavy blunt weapons, like two-handed maces.
Flykick, Dive Strike and Boost Jump are all great ways to speed your way through a dungeon!
Riptide works on any foe who is knocked over, be it from your Gravity push or from any other source.
Slamming the crystal tip of a Fire-imbued staff fires a directed burst of homing fireballs, or slam the base of the staff for a radial burst!
You can grab the mouth of an enemy to muffle their noises, preventing them from alerting their friends.
Electromagnetism works on arrows you shoot and weapons you throw, either with your hands or from Telethrow!
Effects from Charge Sapping are carried between enemies and metal items while Chain Lightning is active!
Skills that affect thrown weapons (e.g. Electromagnetism, Boomerang, Ranged Expertise, Dilation Bubble) also can be triggered via Gravity Push!
Combine Mighty Kick and Flykick to launch enemies far, far away!
The recoil from igniting Inferno Staff can be used to propel yourself!
Fireballs and Thunderbolts from enemy mages can be blocked or deflected if timed correctly.
Focused Reflexes only triggers on projectiles in your field of view. Make sure you are aware of your surroundings!
Gravity-imbued weapons are lighter and easier to wield. Keep this in mind when using large or heavy weapons!
Tesla Wires can be triggered by hitting an enemy Lightning weapon with your own!
Picking up enemies with Marionette is far easier if you stagger them first!

Dormant for thousands of years, ancient Dalgarian Ruins have awoken. Factions all over Eraden rush for the valuable treasure within. The great Crystal Hunt has begun! 
You have been recruited by the Dalgarian Preservation Society in an effort to open a mysterious Dalgarian gate, believed to lead to an ancient and arcane tower. 
Gain new powers, purchase weapons and equipment, and hone your skills. 
Will you uncover the secret of the Dalgarians?

Blade & Sorcery is built for mods and modders, so please enjoy yourself!

 However, we must advise our players that all mods are created independently from Warpfrog, so we cannot vouch for content, quality, or functionality. Warpfrog cannot guarantee technical support for any player-made content.

 Please note, mods can dramatically change the gameplay experience, create performance issues and introduce bugs into the game. If you find a mod has suddenly begun acting strangely it is recommended you remove all mods and start a fresh character save.

Talshi Nakamla

An amphitheater built hundreds of years ago for theatrical combat. Small but suitable for intimate fights.
A lost temple built within a canyon. Between several bridges is a very dangerous drop to the river below.
A citadel built into a mountainside. Has many stairs leading to dangerous heights and a bridge crossing the cliffs to a grand tower.
An old, repurposed outpost in the land of Eraden, occupied by hostile forces. Reach the end and steal their loot.
A marketplace at the heart of an Eradian town. In the dead of night it isn’t quite as bustling.
An abandoned, sacred place of worship belonging to the Eraden Kingdom.
An ancient Dalgarian ruin. Be prepared for a long and treacherous run through a labyrinth.
An old and rather dense library filled with forgotten books.
A small mill built on a stream between fortifications of the outpost.
A small courtyard used as an impromptu training ground.
A place of worship dedicated to the old King Aldaric.
A fortification built upon a beach to defend and watch for invaders.
Complete Outposts to obtain new map pieces
Complete the outpost dungeon to proceed.

Mind Crystal
Strengthen telekinesis to control weapons and enemies alike. Slow your perception of time with Focus to react to danger with super human speed.

Body Crystal
Increase your survivability, enhance unarmed combat abilities and unlock incredible weapon techniques.

Gravity Crystal
Alter gravity to push enemies, and yourself, around the battlefield. Enhance heavy and bludgeoning weapons to knock enemies off their feet.

Lightning Crystal
Cast lightning from your fingertips. Electrocute and stun enemies into submission, and enhance your lightning through imbued weapons.

Fire Crystal
Launch long range fireballs, set enemies ablaze and melt through armor with hot, fire imbued blades.

No Crystal
Start as a blank slate yet to acquire the power of sorcery.

Parean, 
	These archaeologist are talking about crystals and shards a lot lately... 
	I think it would be a good idea to bring some of your crew here to “check it out”.

Everyone, 
	Her Highness, the Royal Battle-Ax, has been sending her soldiers into the mountains to find entrance to some ancient ruins or something. If it is in the interest of the crown of Eraden to find these entrances, then you can bet that means it contains something valuable, which means it is in our interest too! 
	I want men to begin combing the lands and mapping out the terrain to find these entrances before the soldiers do.

Unless you want an Eraden knight's blade shoved in your face, I highly recommend not tryng to map the terrain during daylight, as the mountains are crawling with soldiers. 
	But we have found a better way... 
	The Eraden Scouts are much more efficient at mapping the terrain than us. If opportunity arises, seek to steal their maps instead! Why work harder when we can work smarter? 
	But either way, do not try to enter those ruins on your own! Everything in there belongs to the Boss.
How To Make Lightning THE SAFE WAY (1/2)

Yesterdays little lightning display was embarrassing for us all. If you are going to try to use Sorcery, perhaps read a book first, you idiots! I was peeling charred fingers off the floor all night. 

	Here is how to make lightning THE SAFE WAY:
How To Make Lightning THE SAFE WAY (2/2)

-Consume your shards. 
-Concentrate on the tip of your fingers until it feels like your palm is being brushed by nettles. 
-Point your hand up. NOT AT YOUR FACE. I can't believe this needs to be said. 
-If you smell burning, STOP IMMEDIATELY unless counting on your fingers is not a big deal to you.
-Lastly, and I really should not have to repeat this; DO NOT increase shard usage before you fully master its effects. He-who-shall-remain-nameless had a chain lightning mishap that took out several huts in the process last year. We all know who I am talking about.

Let me get this straight... 
	We are out there stealing maps from Eraden, and now some son of a bitch is stealing maps from us? 
	Get it together or get the lash!

Whoever started the rumour that this map thief is just one person... 
	You are a complete cretin. 
	Half of our lads are veterans of the Canyon Campaigns, and the other half worked as sellswords here and abroad. You really think it’s realistic that one guy can take on our whole gang?
	Fool... 
	Gang leaders, lock it down! Get our maps secure and dish the whip for anyone who continues peddling absurdities about some lone boogeyman thief.

Shards mean money! 
	Sentari fences will pay the boss good money for those things and that means we get paid too, you morons! 
	Get yourselves to that island and see if the rumours about a crystal deposit are true.
There Is No Rule Of Finder Anymore

Listen up! 
	Any crystal shards found must be reported. There is no Rule of Finder anymore! 
	Those who attempt to steal will find their heads stuck on a pike. 

	We will find you!

Doctor Orlean / Outlaw Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 1
	There is so much work for me to do here. The state of those people is unbearable. 
	I've seen more horror in a day staying among the Outlaws than I did in a month at the Royal Hospital. 
	I don't regret my decision, but those crystal shards create so many gruesome effects on their users. I must study them closer to find potential ways to help those poor beings.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaw Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 3
	Just about yesterday, a young boy, maybe 15, decided to double the number of shards he usually takes. 
	After only a few minutes, you could see in his eyes how much he regretted his decision. 
	Being a fire manipulator, the shards seemed to amplify a lot his heat generation. His body turned red, he was sweating profusely. 
	Eventually, it was clear nothing could help the poor lad.

He was quite literally melting in front of my eyes. First the softest part of his body... His eyes started to melt first, and he was screaming in horror for help. Soon enough his agony would be over though. His whole body seemed to either melt and fall to the ground or instantly catch fire.
	After what was left of him collapsed to the floor, the whole thing caught fire, and there were only ashes left of him. I will not forget his desperate cry for help while I could do nothing.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaw Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 14
	Today, a gravity sorcery user came back to the camp claiming to have found and absorbed a Core Gravity Crystal. 
	Regardless of if that was true or not, she proceeded to show of the extents of her new powers to the crowd. She jumped from the top of the nearby cliff, and attempted to control her fall using some gravity pushes. 
	The issue is, she used them much too late. 
	Arriving at full speed to the crowd, she pushed really strong. Way too strong. Three people that were right under her got hit by the gravity ripples in full swing.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaw Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 12
	After about two weeks here, I am exhausted. I would need at least 3 more fellow doctors to assist me in my tasks. 
	While I strive to save as many of these poor souls as possible, the extent to which they hurt themselves is impossible to handle.

The result was horrifying to say the least: all their members were ripped apart. Arms, legs, necks... What was left was a pool of blood, and body parts all around. 
	One thing that really terrified me though is that the gravity sorcery user didn't see the reality of what she did. 
	Under the influence of the crystal, she was euphoric, laughing at the situation, covered in blood. 
	That of course only lasted for some time, and when the effect slowed down, she realized what horror she created.
	She will be executed tomorrow... to send a message to the rest of the group.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 38
	I am running out of time. I decided to attempt a risky experiment on myself.
	I will expose myself to a very small dose of shards to understand the effects. Maybe this will give me some clues as to how bodily functions are influenced by the shards.

	I will journal the effects tomorrow.

Doctor Orlenn / Outlasws Medil Halp Expiditoannn Journal / Day 39
Imm am writring right unders thev effcts of thi shards. It's becoming incr'isngly difflcy to control my emtions and my hadns ar shakling two mach. Buut oh dob i felklk good. I feel amaszzgn. I dont sens anything wrng in my boduy; just... lso muchb joys and pwer! I wiln,l com e vback to this lteer later, njw I wan ts to tri my nwe pwerd.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 40
	Today I feel absolutely terrible. Everything is hurting me. I have a massive headache, and I barely slept last night. 
	The only thing I remember is that I felt great, then increasingly terrible. 
	I couldn't get anything of medical use out of this experiment, if not that I now understand why the Outlaws cannot stop using this thing.
	Of course, they use much more than I did. They must build a tolerance to the shards which causes them to need higher amounts to get the same effect, but with increasingly strong negative effects as well.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 41
	I can now say that I don't feel the need to come back to it. And definitely not the need to increase the dose.
	In any case, with how little I took, I don’t risk falling into it again. 
	It did feel nice though. 
	I wonder if I should try to experiment with a smaller dose to regain some of my consciousness.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 42
	Yesterday, I took some shards again.
	I thought I would only take a smaller dose to carry out medical experiments, but as soon as I took a little, I thought to myself that there would be no harm in taking a bit more since it wasn’t a large dose. 
	Soon enough I found myself taking shards again and again. I am trying to refrain from taking more, and it definitely feels like an effort to do so. 
	I do understand the Outlaws' struggle now. They certainly have a very hard life. Resisting the urge to gain powers again is an immense effort, even at my level.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 43
	I met with one of the pirate leaders, Sakaryan Kravano. I believe he might be the one they call "The Baron" up in Eraden. 
	He confessed disapproving of the sales of shard, and we both agreed that the only way to help the Outlaws would be to stop the sales all together. He will use his influence over the pirate ruler to see what can be done. He mentioned, however, that this could go very wrong, and is even prepared to go into hiding in the worst case scenario. I did not expect a pirate leader to have such kind of morale considerations.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 45
	I have been using shards for a few days in a row already. 
	I told myself that this is the end. I am so angry with myself. How could I, an experienced doctor, expose myself to such a dangerous component? 
	It's over. I won't use this any more again. I may use one tonight to feel the effect one last time, but then it will be over. 
	I have decided to go back to the capital to study my notes in my laboratory in order not to expose myself to the danger of the shards until I find a viable cure for them.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 46
	I lost a leg yesterday. 
	I took more shards. A lot more. Lightning started to emit from my feet uncontrollably, and then my entire body. The feeling was rather pleasant, actually. The outcome, not so much. 
	I have burns all over, and my left leg was so badly damaged that I had to amputate it. 
	I'm stuck here now, and there isn't much I can do about it.

Doctor Orlean / Outlaws Medical Help Expedition Journal / Day 47
	I am feverish and weak, I fear for my life. 
	I sent a letter to the hospital ward in hopes that they will come and rescue me from my misery. 
	In the meantime, I shall rest, and limit my shard consumption as much as I can.

To: Master of The Southern and Northern Seas, Wind Weaver, Ramayan Yandevo. 
	Mate, you don't wanna be here right now. Patrons of my little shop have brought news that the Queen is hell-bent on finding and torturing shard consumers right now. Her ruthlessness is so creative it makes me wonder what her childhood was like... Sheesh! 
	I understand the market demand for crystals in Rakta and Khar-Tib is booming right now, and as one Sentari to another, believe me, I do, but I implore you... Ramayan, put an end to shard sales.

Even if you disregard the hazards to the consumers health, consider that if the Crown turns towards the Southern Seas in an attempt to throttle resellers, Sentara may become a direct target of the Kingdom of Eraden itself! 
        I will be keeping a continued low profile on my little island, but if I start to see those Eraden sails coming my way, I'm outta here. Luckily the proximity of the storm keeps most away. 
With the assurance to hear back from the Seas, 
Sakaryan Kravano, Guild Captain
Southern Seas Guild New Purchase Policy (1/4)

Southern Seas Guild New Purchase Policy
	By decree from Our Leader, Master of The Southern and Northern Seas, Wind Weaver, Ramayan Yandevo, a new Shard Price Policy Shall Be Effective Starting Today:
- Minimum purchase quantity for Crystal Shards is abolished, but any purchase under 5 Shards will now be raised to 20 Coin per Shard.
- 5 to 10 Shards purchased, 10 Coin.
- 10 to 100 Shards, 5 Coin.
Southern Seas Guild New Purchase Policy (2/4)

Push for the larger quantities, lads! The buyer has your money, so take it and don't take no for an answer. 
- For selling larger quantities, consult directly with a local Guild Captain for a tailored quote.
	Note: Crystal Core are not for sale anymore. Anyone found reselling Crystal Cores will face the Justice of the Southern Seas. Core owned must be transferred to the Guild Immediately for a compensation
Southern Seas Guild New Purchase Policy (3/4)

New Shard Regulation
	The “Rule Of Finder” is NOT valid any more following a series of abuses. 
	Any shard that is found, bought or mined must be turned in to the Guild in exchange for generous compensation. 
	Any shard vein discovered must be reported to the Guild in exchange for generous compensation. 
	Failing to follow these regulations will lead to mast-heading and flogging.
Southern Seas Guild New Purchase Policy (4/4)

Recruitment
	The two Guild members found guilty of stealing Shards from Ramayan Yandevo have been hung and displayed on the approach to Graystone. 
	The Guild is seeking new replacements. Contact the nearest Captain for more information. 
	All loyal Guild members will be compensated generously.

Parean, 
	Heed this warning, for next time I will not be so patient. 
	Your ranks swell with slithering snakes who siphon shards from our family. The stock numbers do not lie. 
	You are a Captain, so I hold you personally responsible to fix this. I want you to find these disloyal thieves and feed them to the rats. 
	Resolve this, Parean, or the next shipment that is light will end with YOU being fed to the rats instead.
Ramayan To Sakaryan - Ploting Against Me

I see it all now, Sakaryan... 
	You are out there, plotting against me. You refuse to push shards. You take food from our family's mouth. Fool... you will make a powerful enemy out of me. 
Continue the operation and I may show mercy.
Sakaryan To All Captains - I Call For Common Sense (1/3)
Sakaryan To All Captains - I Call For Common Sense (3/3)

Fellow Masters of the Southern Seas, Free Storm Tamers, Wind Listeners,
	Hello mates, you should all have received this identical letter, sealed by the Crest of the Four Southern Seas. This is an urgent matter that requires all our attentions. 
	I received a very concerning correspondence from our Leader, Master of The Southern and Northern Seas, Wind Weaver, Ramayan Yandevo. I can't hide this any more lads, he is losing his mind.

If you have sailed through Eraden you will no doubt have seen the extremely heightened levels of military activity. The Queen is hell-bent on hunting down outlaws and shard peddlers right now, so to engage in such activities at this time is downright madness. 
	To create an enemy of Eraden is to invite destruction for both our Guild, and us, individually. I have tried repeatedly to appeal to Ramayan as the young man I knew growing up in Sentara, but he is not the Ramayan I knew. He is paranoid, agitated, hollowed. I am starting to suspect that Ramayan himself may be using shards.
Sakaryan To All Captains - I Call For Common Sense (2/3)

I have been a Captain of the Guild since its inception. You all know my devotion and loyalty, but I must speak up as I have seen what shards do to people. 
        I have witnessed an Eraden Doctor on his death bed, entirely corrupted by the shards. I see the wretches known as The Eye, barely human by now, crawling across the lands in desperate search of their obsession. By the gods, are we to ignore that even the whole nation of Rakta has fallen under a black spell? 
	This is not our Guild, lads. 
	I call for common sense. What does your gut and conscience say? 
With the assurance to hear back from the Seas, 
Sakaryan Kravano, Guild Captain
Your Life Is In Danger, Sakaryan

Sakaryan, 
	Forgive the informality that the urgency of this letter required. 
	Your life is in danger. Ramayan wishes you dead. 
	Several Captains have deserted. Several executed... It is madness. 
	As you suspected, Ramayan has fallen under the influence. A great purge has begun. The Guild is no more. Seek safe harbour until we manage to fight back. I have ties with the Dalgarian Presertvation Society. They will help you find safe passage out of Eraden in return for a favour. Standby for their contact. 
Stay safe my friend. 
Affelen Taelnis

My Leader, Master of The Southern and Northern Seas, Wind Weaver, Ramayan Yandevo. 
	I regret to inform you that some of your Captains are plotting against you. I intercepted some of their letters and your suspicions were right, My Leader. 
	I stand faithful by your side, and I am ready to establish a plan with you to regain control, and punish those who attempted to betray you. I will show you I am worthy of your trust, and as a token of my faithfulness, I send 20 crates of crystal shards as a measure of my respect. 
With the assurance to hear back from the Seas, Captain Parean Loneta, The Eraden

To All Members, 
	As I rule over those uncharted territories, it is by my benevolence that you enjoy your freedom. 
	Loyalty received, trust given. But times are changing. 
	You see, there is a problem; Crystal Shards are missing.

How foolish are you to believe I do not see you. 
	Everyday, cargo missing. I see you lurk in the shadow, ready to steal them as soon as I am not looking. To steal my Shards. Thieves, I know where you are! 
	Come forward and be punished with mercy, or dragged from the shadows and punished with cruelty. 
	You will regret having betrayed me. There will be no further warning. The Southern Seas Guild does not take thievery lightly. 
Ramayan Yandevo, Master of The Southern and Northern Seas, Wind Weaver, Leader of the Southern Seas Guild

I don't know how to find you guys, so I'm leaving my message here.
	I'm the guy with the missing right eye and half of his body burnt. I got some reports on sorcerers that are definitely worthy of your time.
	I know a guy that can create a tornado out of thin air, and another that can throw exploding fireballs.
	I can point you in their directions in exchange for a few shards...

I have been informed you and the Dalgarian Preservation Society are looking for entrances to Dalgarian ruins. I will not ask why! 
	You will not be alone in this effort; competing factions all over Eraden are combing the lands to also find these entrances. These factions have set temporary bases in derelict outposts all across the mainland in an effort to map out the terrain. Your best bet to find the Dalgarian ruins is to steal the efforts of others! 
	Retrieve these maps and you may piece together the location of a Dalgarian ruin. To get you started, I've marked the location of an outpost on the map. As I hear news on the location of more outposts, I will mark them on the map each day. 
Good luck, friend!

Hello mate! 
	Welcome to Eraden. It seems we have a mutual friend at the Dalgarian Preservation Society. As a personal favour to Affelen, I will be glad to meet you and offer some guidance on the task that lies before you. 
	When you are settled, take the small boat that is docked in the pier and come meet me at The Baron's Bounty. It’s my store located on a small island nearby. 
Cheers! 
The Baron

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes 
	I do not like this new climate we now face. I long for our old land. The cold tundra, and its biting frost. 
	Here, the sun beats down too hard, leaving my skin raw with blisters. I follow our K'ran Valdstor, and I know his words are meant to protect our River Clan. 
	But these lands, they are not ours. We must leave our homes, yes, but why must we travel so far? 
	I will raise this issue at our next clan gathering

Yesterday, Valdstor sent forth our exploration team to follow the guidance of Davsald, our Druid. 
	I suspect that he may be harbouring doubts about whether the times of Khemenet are truly upon us. He has instructed us to seek out the nearest Hekalis, following Davsald's tracking. He has tasked us with confirming with our own eyes whether it lies dormant or not.

Valdstor has always been a man of skepticism, and I cannot blame him for his apprehension. 
	After all, if we had ventured so far from our homeland for nothing, I fear that the Clans would soon tear apart. The thought of reliving the clan wars I witnessed as a child fills me with dread.
The Gateway To The Zorik Vamo-Rlin.

We have discovered the gateway that leads to the Zorik Vamo-Rlin. 
	To ascertain whether the Hekalis has awoken, we must venture beyond this gate. Our druid, Davsald needs to rest tonight, as she has vowed to attempt to open the gateway and take the trial tomorrow morning. 
	I have faith in her ability, for her mastery of sorcery surpasses any other druid I have encountered. Who knows, perhaps she is the reincarnation of the Khemenet? 
	Tonight, I shall dream the dreams of our ancestors and pray that our salvation is near.

Today will be remembered in our memories as a tragedy, and a promise. 
	Our druid, Davsald opened the gate. She was worthy of the trial. Before our very eyes, the Hekalis awoken and rose to full power, inviting their challenger. Tears of joy streamed down our faces, for we all grasped the significance. 
	The era of Khemenet is upon us! Our deliverance is imminent! What an honor to be bestowed our existence during this sacred witnessing!

The tragedy, however, quickly turned the tears of joy into the tears of mourning. 
	Davsald decided to go through with the trial, and she challenged the Hekalis. Nothing could have prepared me to witness such a level of power. She fought bravely, but she was no match. After she threw a fireball at one of its crystals of power, the Hekalis became enraged.

It rushed towards her, arms swinging at full speed. She was crushed, over and over again. Once the Hekalis stopped, there was almost nothing left of her body, just traces of guts and blood on the path of its rage. 
	While I mourn her death and lament that she is not the chosen Vessel of Khemenet, I am honoured to have witnessed her unparalleled resilience and power. 
	May she find her rightful place in the Layak Naa.
For Those Who Dwell Far From Our Homelands (1/2)
For Those Who Dwell Far From Our Homelands (2/2)

Yet, we must hear the whispers of our ancestors, for the time of the Khemenet is upon us. Kayosva, our celestial beacon of hope, shines ever brighter in the heavens, signalling the imminent return of our saviours. 
	Our lands have become too dangerous for us to stay. The Forest Clan have narrowly escaped the wrath of the Fire Jikarazin, Vayularim himself, who unleashed his fury upon the dense forests, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake. 
	But fear not, for the Khemenet is soon to walk among us. With their guidance, we shall reclaim our beloved homelands and bring prosperity for generation to come! 
	Until then, let us keep our faith close to our hearts in the promise of a brighter tomorrow. 
Hail the River Clan! 
Hail the Khemenet!

Hear our voice! 
	Our K'ran, Valdstor Dalgansen, has words to spread for those who dwell far from our homelands and cannot join us in this momentous celebration.
	Brothers and sisters, members of the River Clan, I understand the sorrows in your hearts as we bid farewell to the lands that have been our home for generations. 
	This decision, made in council with our allies, the Forest Clan and the Mountain Clan, was not taken lightly.

Your Majesty, 
	I am on my journey back from the northern Wildfolk tribes. I have so much knowledge I am absolutely eager to share with you as soon as I will be back. 
	As a small gift to satisfy your interest in the olden cultures of Eraden, I present to you a translated folk song I heard during my stay at K'ran Valdstor Dalgansen's Clan. It is a celebration song for the spring. I trust that your court musician should be able to play it tuned to our standards. I believe my stay will strengthen our relationships.

Your Majesty, My Queen, without further ado I present to you "The Revival Of Our Land"

The New Vessel Of The Khemenet

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes
	Half of our warriors were murdered by a powerful Sorcerer in one of our outposts nearby. Valdstor told us to not interfere. Says they could be the next Vessel of the Khemenet. 
	Such level of brutality does not strike as one that the Khemenet would display. I believe dark forces to be at play here, and I refuse to see our clan members decimated by a Sorcerer with such cruelty. 
	I will inform the other clan leaders to seek their wisdom.
This Sorcerer Cannot Be The Khemenet

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes
	The leader of the Forest Clan, shares my conviction. This sorcerer cannot possibly be the Khemenet. 
	All their victims lie in pieces or bare disfiguration. No warrior of Khemenet's height would fall to such barbarity willingly. This sorcerer is nothing but vile, driven solely by the thirst for power, and they must be eliminated. 
	It is imperative to ensure that the Khemenet's rightful path remains undisturbed. I have rallied a group of my most skilled warriors to track down this sorcerer. Tomorrow, we shall set an ambush and bring an end to their bloody path.

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes 
	We encountered a representative of a group calling themselves The Eye. Their intentions and beliefs were unclear, but it seems they too are being hunted by the Eraden from the South. 
	They proposed forming an alliance with us
We Must Remain Cautious Of The Eye

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes
	My suspicions were not well founded. Our K'ran took a look at the chalice that "The Eye" gave us. The marking on it seems to be an old representation of Kayosva, our Guide and Beacon Of Hope. We will meet the representative again, to make sure it is indeed Kayosva represented on their gift. 
	I remain cautious of their intention. Our next encounter will tell if I must raise my trust.

Davsald Dalgansen, Druid of the River Clan / Travel Notes
	Our encounter with The Eye turned into a fierce battle. There were losses on both sides, but we fought bravely. 
	Initially, we engaged in a discussion to discern their intentions, but it became evident that our beliefs diverged entirely. While we both praise Kayosva, their beliefs are fanatical. They portray her as an entity that would actively try to prevent the cycle of the Khemenet. 
	What's more, they believe in the superiority of druids over those who lack the ability to wield Sorcery. Last, and most importantly, they believe the Khemenet to be a suppressor of Sorcery. An enslaver more than a savoir.

Upon understanding this, our K'ran sounded the war cry. 
	With the element of surprise on our side, we managed to eliminate a significant number of their sorcerers. However, we soon recognized the need to withdraw. 
	They wield weapons imbued with Sorcery, able to slice arms and legs like butter... able to send the heaviest warriors flying in the air. 
	Elgfarenm was entirely burnt with lightning emanating from an axe, as if Kondalarim himself inhabited its metal core, before his legs and arms were sliced by a fire sword. These artefacts appear to be crafted from an ancient metal unfamiliar to us. 
	I wonder if the ruins we now inhabit hold the power to enable us to forge such weapons. We must find means to acquire some and unravel their secrets.

The Youth of the village need to understand better the Jikarazhins. They lost all their landmarks, and they must understand better the reason why we needed to go, and why we will return soon. 
	I thought of this simple story based on olden legends of our ancestors...

The Jikarazin are pure spirits of Sorcery. They are not one, they are not many! They are the Sorcery flowing through everything, and they are all the ways Sorcery affects us! They can take many shapes. Some bring joy and aid. Some bring sadness and destruction
	Kondalarim sometimes lights up the sky at night, guiding us through the woods! Kondalarim sometimes show terrible anger; makes us so scared, we cant move any more!

Zankalarim helps us build our houses; gives us the strength to carry all the trees! Zankalarim can make the earth shake, and collapse our house, or make the heavy trees fall on our heads! 
	Vayularim cook our meals, and warms our hands during the cold and dark winter! Vayularim turns forest to ashes on the warmest summer nights!
	We must respect the Jikharazin strength! Thank them for them help, and move away from their anger. When they are angry, we may need to rest away from our lands. When they are kind, life is good and easy!
Increase your survivability, enhance unarmed combat abilities and unlock incredible weapon techniques.
Strengthen telekinesis to control weapons and enemies alike. Slow your perception of time with Focus to react to danger with super human speed.
Launch long range fireballs, set enemies ablaze and melt through armor with hot, fire imbued blades.
Cast lightning from your fingertips. Electrocute and stun enemies into submission, and enhance your lightning through imbued weapons.
Alter gravity to push enemies, and yourself, around the battlefield. Enhance heavy and bludgeoning weapons to knock enemies off their feet.
Lightning Spray is not slowed down when you are in Slow Time or Hyperfocus.
Jump again in the air to dash forwards.
Punch downwards while falling with Gravity equipped to trigger a shockwave when you hit the ground.
With a lightning imbued staff, press the use button and swing to whip a shocking, slicing wire of lightning.
Wide and continuous swings with a weapon will slightly increase effectiveness and dismemberment power.
Shields will ricochet into enemies when thrown, and attempt to return to you on the second bounce.
You can launch yourself by throwing a Gravity Push downwards. If you’re in the air, you can push yourself in any direction. Unlocking this skill also boosts your Gravity charge speed and push force.
You can grab enemies with two hands and pull to tear off their limbs, as well as slice off limbs with an open-palm chop.
Cast fire while grabbing an enemy to ignite them, dealing damage over time.
Lightning Spray chains lightning between enemies and metallic objects.

Lightning Spray will sap magic from a Lightning-imbued weapon or spell in your other hand, granting it increased range and power. Unlocking this skill also boosts your Lightning charge speed, and allows you to spray for longer.
Adds a multiplier to the AI charge speed boost.
Regenerate Focus from combat actions, such as parrying, achieving headshots, disarming enemies, deflecting fireballs, and killing enemies.
Ignited enemies can spread Ignition to nearby enemies.
Remote Detonating a fireball on an Ignited enemy or corpse causes a homing projectile to emerge.
The Gravity Bubble now slows time for all objects inside it. Thrown items will keep their velocity when they exit the bubble, and you consume Focus at a vastly reduced rate.
Blunt damage delivered to enemies heads causes them to be stunned.
While airborne, punch with your fist, strike with a shield or stab with a dagger to propel yourself forwards. Unlocking this skill also increases your max health.
Lightning imbued arrows and throwing weapons are attracted to enemies when shot or thrown.
Enemies remain slowed for a few seconds when you run out of Focus while time is slowed.
Gravity push a burning enemy to spread heat to nearby enemies, eventually causing them to ignite.
Cast and hold the gravity spell towards the ground to slow your fall.
While blade dancing, enemies can no longer follow and block your incoming strikes, leaving them wide open.
Fireballs can bounce off surfaces and metal armor, ricocheting into nearby enemies.
Charge Sapping fire magic will Ignite enemies hit by Lightning Spray.
Cast gravity while grabbing an enemy to Levitate them.
Kicking while airborne will launch you forward.
Enter Hyperfocus automatically when a projectile is coming towards you.
Telegrab an enemy by the neck to slowly choke them to death.
Charge gravity while making a fist and punch to inflict Levitation to enemies.
A point blank, pinpoint Gravity Push to enemy limbs can dismember them.
With a staff, aim it at an object or enemy and press the use button to grab and freely manipulate it.
Charge Sapping gravity magic will inflict Levitation on enemies hit by Lightning Spray.
Charge the Fire spell and throw your hand without releasing it to punch a cone of flames that deals damage and Ignites enemies.
Fireballs stagger enemies and impart extra force on objects hit.
Fireballs grabbed out of the air and thrown with Telekinesis home in on enemies.
Hold the Slow Time button down to enter Hyperfocus. Time moves incredibly slowly, but you do not. Unlocking this skill also increases your maximum focus pool.
Fireball will light enemies on fire for a short time.
Enemies caught in the radius of a remote detonation will heat up and eventually ignite.
Attacks with blunt gravity imbued weapons send enemies flying.
You are much harder to detect when crouching, and can pickpocket weapons from enemies.
With a fire imbued staff, press the use button to spray a torrent of flames. Watch the recoil...
Enemies that witness death and brutality of their allies may surrender to you in fear. Unlocking this skill also increases your max health.
Become an unstoppable force while sprinting, knocking back enemies you come into contact with.
Levitated enemies will slam to the ground once Levitation wears off.
Telekinesis now works on enemies. Unlocking this skill also increases your maximum focus pool.
Gravity imbued weapons weigh much less, allowing for easier handling.
Imbues held melee weapon with Fire. For NPC use only.
Imbues held melee weapon with Gravity. For NPC use only.
Imbues held melee weapon with Lightning. For NPC use only.
Kicks have increased power, now capable of sending enemies flying.
Fire imbued weapons spray molten metal when swung that Ignites enemies.
Lightning Spray gains a burst of power and damage just before you run out of charge.
Merge a fire and lightning spell, then pull your palms apart to blow a stream of white-hot flames that leaves a trail of magma.
Drawing a bow while in the air triggers Hyperfocus with no Focus cost.
Arrows and daggers pierce through enemies, and you throw weapons with more force.
Massively increase the range of your Gravity Push.
Charging a Fireball detonates the last fireball you threw with that hand, creating an explosion. Unlocking this skill also boosts your Fire charge speed, fireball damage and enemies burn for longer.
Remote Detonation pushes enemies back, staggering them.
Detonate two fireballs simultaneously to link them, superheating the air and igniting everything between them.
Telegrab two limbs of an enemy and pull apart to dismember them!
After you knock a creature over with a Gravity Push, quickly grip to hold them in the air, then throw to propel them.
Charge fire while making a fist and punch to rocket you and your enemies away.
Cheat death once a day. When triggered, nearby enemies are knocked over and you enter a brief rage, with increased strength and speed. Unlocking this skill also increases your max health.
Cast Lightning while grabbing an enemy to electrocute them and deal damage over time.
Parrying enemy attacks with a Lightning-imbued weapon causes them to be electrocuted.
After being Electrocuted, enemies fall over.
Summon a massive lightning tornado that shocks and sweeps up everything nearby.
Throw enemies with Telekinesis to stagger them in a direction.
Zapping enemy weapons with Lightning Spray has a chance to disarm them.
Merge a fire and gravity spell to throw a supernova that collapses into a black hole.
Attract and repel an item at the same time (trigger + spell wheel button) to rapidly spin it in the air. Costs Focus.
Throw objects you have grabbed with Telekinesis.
Enemies are briefly slowed when you successfully parry an attack.
Touching two lightning imbued weapons together forms a slicing Arcwire between them for a short time.
Charge and throw the Lightning spell to launch a thunderbolt that chains to nearby enemies. Benefits from Charge Sapping.
Charge lightning while making a fist and punch an enemy to shock them nearby enemies in a burst of sparks.
Pull everything towards you when you Boost Jump.
Steal weapons out of enemies hands by grabbing the hand with Telekinesis and pulling.
Briefly become weightless after using a Boost Jump.
Objects that you Telegrab become lighter weight and easier to handle.
Dual-pushing enemies makes them weightless for a time
Grabbing enemies with two hands allows you to pick them up and throw them around.

Charge a Fireball by holding down the Spell Trigger. Once the spell is fully charged, throw your hand forward and release the trigger to cast the fireball. The fireball can be guided through the air with your hand.
Weapons imbued with Fire can penetrate the thickest armor and even solid walls.
Fire Imbue a Staff to trigger a Fire Slam.

Charge two fire spells separately, then merge your hands together to combine them. Once the merge is fully charged, you can throw a massive, explosive meteor. Unlocking this skill also enhances your Fire charge speed, increases fireball damage, and extends the duration of enemies burning.
Charge the Gravity Spell by holding down the Spell Trigger. Once the spell is fully charged, throw your hand forward and release the trigger to cast a gravity wave that can stagger enemies.
Some weapons can be Imbued with Sorcery by holding a spell over them for some time. A Gravity Imbued weapon makes enemies levitate for a while.
Slam a Gravity imbued staff to create a wave of gravity that inflicts Levitation.
Merge two Gravity spells, then pull your hands apart to create a bubble of zero gravity. Unlocking this skill also boosts your Gravity charge speed and push force.
Cast the lightning spell by holding down the Spell Trigger and tilt your hand forward to spray lightning bolts that electrocute enemies. Must be recast after a short time.
Lightning-imbued weapons can electrocute and stun enemies for a short time.
Slam a Lightning-imbued staff to electrocute nearby enemies.
Merge two lightning spells, then spread your palms to unleash a beam of pure electricity. Unlocking this skill also boosts your Lightning charge speed, and allows you to spray for longer.
Utilize Focus to slow time by pressing the Slow Time button. Focus runs out but can regain when not being used. Unlocking this skill also increases your maximum focus pool.
Grab objects from a distance by aiming your hand at them and grabbing.
Further merges will only give shards
Zap burning enemies with Lightning to extend the burn effect.
Zap floating enemies with Lightning to extend the float effect.
Imbues enemy weapons with a random imbue.
Imbues NPC arrows with a random imbue.
The greatest secret of the Dalgarian race.

If you are reading this, you made it alive to the island. Congratulations. 
	Head towards the Gate inside the cave. You can not possibly miss it. If you see it activate, then our contract still stands. 
	Beware: It is not safe around here. The weather around here is unforgiving, and Outlaws are constantly looking for more shards and could be around now that we're gone.

You will find the Crystal Core we promised you next to the Monolith. It should react to you when you place it in one of the receptacles.
	The locals built a shelter around it. Use it as you wish, but do remember about our deal. The trust we put in your abilities needs to bear its fruits too. 
	Do not underestimate the Dalgarian Preservation Society. 
R.V.
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Last Day (1/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Last Day
	Looking at the shore already makes me melancholic. This is my last day on this island.
	There is so much left to translate, so many artefacts I want to take a look at! I can feel a rumbling behind the rocks. Who knows what kind of Dalgarian Sorcery I could discover there! I wish I could stay a few more months, at least! In any case, I am still going to study Dalgarian ruins on my next assignment. I just hope it will be worth a trip through the storm once again.
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Last Day (2/2)

They surely are not letting new recruits rest at the Dalgarian Preservation Society. Almost a month I joined already, and I haven't been given any time off.
	No matter how exciting the work is, if I am truly honest with myself, I really need a rest.

Such an exciting time!!! 
	I believe we finally have found it! Here they are, the doors to the Aminira Nar Kayosvam! 
	If my translations are correct, this is the best time in history to be an archaeologist. 
	I am so happy I was accepted in the Dalgarian Preservation Society. This is a dream come true! 
B.T.

“The crowd was cheering (applauding?) for the candidates to the Zorik Vamo-Rlin All lined up in front of the gate, ready to receive their blessings Will one of them prove to be the Khemenet's vessel? Only time will tell Time will bring justice (Raein told me that was an old Dalgarian saying) The crowd began chanting the Gift Of The Sword Of Naa" And there was hope in all their hearts that the time of the Khemenet would soon be upon us Aaand done with the translation! Can't contain excitement! AAAH!

Affelen, 
	I don't know how to say this elegantly, so here comes: I won't home for the Birth of Purity Celebration. 
	I know Mom really cares about it. Tell her I really wanted to come. I have good reasons, though!
	The whole Dalgarian Preservation Society is in a state of extreme excitement these days – at least, I surely am. We managed to make amazing discoveries thanks to the sudden activation of all the Dalgarian Sorcery Markers. We possibly found the Aminira Nar Kayosvam; the temple where the Dalgarians witnessed the rebirth of their prophet and savoir, the Khemenet!!! 
	I know you think I am too much of a book worm, but come on. You know how much this matters to me.

Tomorrow I will be travelling to one of the Dalgarian Ruins we identified. I was tasked to research and investigate Sorcery controlling and limiting devices. That seems quite far from my usual assignments, but... I think those are orders from the Queen herself. Things are going way too fast for me now... 
	I will write you some more when I arrive there! 
Bryen
	P.S. Please don't tell Mom too much about what I am working on. You know she isn't as enthusiastic as I am about the old beliefs… No need to worry her. Especially with the Birth of Purity celebration coming.

Affelen, 
	I just arrived at the Dalgarian Ruins to which I have been assigned. It will probably be some time before I can message you again. 
	The whole location is very mysterious… And seriously scary. 
	There is so much I want to understand, but everything feels so foreign! 
	I realized that our understanding of the Dalgarians is quite limited. Despite the Preservation Society's existence for roughly 600 years, we've only managed to fill our library with texts that would fill merely a third of the Royal Library. I am so happy that the Dalgarian Sorcery Markers suddenly activated and revealed some locations to explore.

But I wonder, why now? Why those places in particular? It’s almost as if the Dalgarians had it all calculated a long time ago… 
	I hope you received my previous letter; I told the archaeologist I was working with to take care of sending it, but he is a little forgetful… 
	I hope the southern seas are treating you well! I will write to you again. 
Bryen
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 1

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 1
	I have decided to keep a small journal while exploring these ruins, I think I need this to not go crazy from the ominous silence here. 
	We know the Dalgarians practised Sorcery, but I hadn't realized how much until now!
	Everything here is powered by, or uses some form of Sorcery. It is fascinating, but also terribly unsettling! 
	I am going into a world I barely understand, and I feel a sense of danger I cannot explain. 
	It's kinda weird that they are sending me alone on this though. I'm quite new, and already they trust me with this? I won't complain though.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 2 (1/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 2
	What a day! So many discoveries! 
	I found the locations of three ancient Dalgarian machines, including one I know well. We have a similar one at the Preservation Society. 
	The only difference? This one is infused with Sorcery. It glows and moves by itself! What could explain this difference? 
	I'm new here so I don't want to give my real opinion to my mentors, but I think that everything seem to be more and more related to Sorcery over time. Here, seems like every day things glow brighter and brighter!
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 2 (2/2)

I don't know, this almost makes me want to believe in the old prophecy of the Khemenet that the Dalgarians believed in. More and more Sorcery, a bright light in the star.... 
	Was their prophecy all real?? Well, in any case, I should keep this to myself. That's not really something I should say publicly in Eraden if I want to keep my head on my shoulders... 
	The silence is heavy in these ruins... I think it's beginning to make me a bit crazy. Just the other day, I thought I heard footsteps echoing in corridor. 
	Maybe I'm not so alone here in the end.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 3 (1/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 3
	Today, I went down deeper into the ruins. Literally went down a staircase for almost an hour. The air was so thick and dusty, I thought I was going to die there. 
	I actually almost did die! I saw an enormous column fall over just a few meters away from me. 
	Mental note: keep an eye on everything, everywhere, all the time.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 3 (2/2)

I’m starting to enjoy the solitude though. I can concentrate on my work, and writing this journal is keeping me busy and sane. 
	I’ve realized why I was tasked to look for Sorcery limiting machineries; With the Sorcery getting stronger every day, it must be for the Purifying Bracelets that Eraden uses for their Thralls. 
	I really don't like this practice. No matter how much Sorcery corrupts our souls," as my Mom would say, our Society can only function if it receives financing from the Crown. So I guess I should be grateful I get to study here.
	For my age, I'm pretty lucky, I guess.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 14

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 14
	I am screwed. Totally screwed. 
	I was looking at sculptures of Jikarazhins in a temple when a disaster happened. I got impatient when trying to go through a tight passage, and it collapsed behind me. 
	I probably pushed some rock or something. Now I am trapped in some kind of observatory. I don’t know if I will get out of here alive...
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 15-18 (1/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Days 15-18 
	I've been lost in this maze of Dalgarian ruins for days, with only the sounds of old sorcery to keep me company. 
	The darkness and the silence was driving me crazy, until I was finally saved. Just when I thought I was going to lose it, I heard some whispers coming from the shadows. Out popped a bunch of Wildfolk. Those northern tribal people. 
	Their druid sensed my presence, and they found me.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 15-18 (2/2)

Even though I don't speak their language, we managed to find ways to communicate. They took me in, showing me around the ruins and such. 
	I think they still believe in the old Khemenet prophecy, from what I could understand. Their Druid's healing hand felt pure, like an Essence of all things. 
	Makes me rethink the way we perceive Sorcery in Eraden. Their sorcery was nothing like what I can recall from Thralls, or in the Dalgarian machineries. 
	It was raw, but calling it Corruption? Couldn't be further from the truth.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 19 (1/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 19
	Day 19 of my archaeological expedition through Dalgaria was a day of tragedy. The trust I had been building with the Wildfolk was gone in a moment when Eradan royal guard force suddenly arrived. 
	I will remember the sound of their synchronized footsteps all my life, I think. As the guards came out from the shadows, the Wildfolk looked terrified. I could see they were suspicious of me; That I somehow betrayed their trust and led the royal forces to their hidden encampment. 
	Before I could do anything, the guards opened fire. Archers on a cliff fired so many arrows. Between the arrows and the soldiers that came after, the Wildfolk had no chance...
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 19 (2/2)

The soldiers showed no mercy. I saw the corpses of the people I knew mutilated and lying dead on the ground before me.
	They welcomed me into their community, shared their knowledge with me, and showed me nothing but compassion... and now they are gone. 
	I have been taken by the soldiers now. I will never forget the look of betrayal in the eyes of the Wildfolk, or their screams as they were cut down. This day has changed me forever.
Journal Through the Dalgarian World Day 20

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal Through the Dalgarian World / Day 20
	I have been retrieved by the royal force, but I somehow feel more in danger now. I am being sent back to Yltea, but not the way I hoped. 
	They say I have been corrupted by the Wildfolk; that I must be purified. With the current crusade against Corruption that the Queen started, I can only imagine what that means. 
	I hope the Preservation Society will help me somehow. I don't want to die so young...
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 1 (1/2)
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 1 (2/2)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Day 1
	We just arrived on the island. It’s all so exciting but I can’t help but feel underqualified for this.
	This is my first real field assignment, and I am with Raein himself! I really don't want to disappoint him.

The villagers here seem friendly, but they are totally unaware of the importance of what they found. The entrance was initially hidden, revealed only when they accidentally broke through a cave wall in their rock quarry. Tomorrow we will build a scaffolding to access it. My mentor, Raein, is too old to climb those rocks, but he definitely needs to be able to access the Dalgarian ruin. 
	I plan to inspect the site, but from what I can see already, I think I'm the luckiest member of the Dalgarian Preservation Society!
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 2

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Day 2
	This Dalgarian ruin is absolutely massive!! My mentor believes it could even be the entrance to the Aminira Nar Kayosvam! If that’s true, then could there be the Sword of Naa behind that gate?! 
	The thought that I may really see the sword I've been imagining when reading all those books at our library makes me so grateful to be where I am now! The villagers, on the other hand, are totally uninterested. 
	I've begun to transcribe the Dalgarian texts engraved around the gate, but I am not entirely literate in Dalgarian just yet. I plan to ask Raein for help if he's not too busy, but this will take me some time in any case. I must not be so impatient!
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 3 (1/3)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Day 3 
	My Dalgarian is rusty, but I think I am almost done with my translations. 
	I wonder how we will open the gate though... 
	If you are Dalgarian, just wait patiently until the return of the Khemenet...
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 3 (2/3)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Day 3
	Jokes aside, it would probably take the power of all our Thralls combined to make the slightest crack on that door. 
	I read all the books on the Khemenet in our library and found no traces of ways to open that door. And of course, with no Dalgarians left to tell us their secrets, our research will surely be quite tedious…
Bryen - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 3 (3/3)

Bryen Taelnis / Archaeology Journal On The Gate Island / Day 3
	Old legends or not, I'm sure the Sword of Naa is real. 
	The weather around here is not normal. I worry that strong Sorcery is active here. If The Eye finds out about this place, we’re toast. 
	Maybe I can get Raein to request more guards around here. I find it unsettling to be near such level of Corruption.
Raein - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 1

Raein Valentir / The Gate Island Journal / Day 1
	While Bryen is studying the gate, I am concentrating on the monolith in the villager's house. If my intuition is correct, this could be a praying monolith of the Wildfolks, built directly over a Dalgarian Teaching stone relic.
	Seeing this with my own eyes, I wonder what would happen if we placed Crystal Cores on the receptacles. It might be too old and damaged, but I can’t help but wonder... 
	I am requesting Crystal Cores to be dispatched here so I may run some tests. Hopefully the guards won't object.
	Bryen is young. Her level of excitement is a lot for my old bones to keep up with, but I must admit, I was just as annoying at her age. Perhaps even more-so. She shows a lot of potential.
Raein - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 4 (1/2)
Raein - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 4 (2/2)

Raein Valentir / The Gate Island Journal / Day 4
	Bryen is done translating the Dalgarian inscriptions. It seems that my intuition was correct, and we discovered an entrance to the Aminira Nar Kayosvam. What a wonderful day! I wish my old bones could carry me up there, but I am in pain merely at the thought of it. 
	I have dispatched Bryen to another archaeology mission.

The Queen has requested that we look for more sorcery negation technology in the ruins to maintain the Kingdom's control over their Thralls. I do not really approve of her use of the Dalgarian Preservation Society, but we need funds. 
	I am going back to Yltea myself. I have been informed that my astronomers have reports that need urgent attention. I wonder if Bryen is ready to join the inner circle. She is young and inexperienced, but if we are pressed by time we may soon need more people on board to support the completion of the Khemenet prophecy.

Dalgarian Preservation Society / The Study of the Khemenet Mythology 
	The Dalgarians believed reality consists of two energy fields: The Layak Naa and the Mayak Naa. 
	We do not have many traces of their beliefs left but our theory is that the Layak Naa is a way to represent our mind; our will. It’s our ability to make decisions, and, in a way, have control over reality. 
	The Mayak Naa, on the contrary, is raw power. It's the Sorcery that can occur within us, and it's the energy that moves everything, ourselves including.

The Dalgarians seemed to believe that when the Layak Naa meets the Mayak Naa, the Khemenet appears. A human entity able to manipulate Sorcery with no effort, and able to control the Jikarazin. 
	We do not know what those are just yet, but we suspect they are entities of Sorcery

Dalgarian Preservation Society / Inner Circle Education 
	If you are reading this, it means you have been approved by Raein himself to be part of the inner circle of the Dalgarian Preservation Society. 
	Your access to the inner circle will be completed gradually, as what you will learn is going to make it difficult for you to assimilate. 
	Read the following books in the order indicated. You will find them in the restricted section of our library.
- Kayosva: An Astronomical Phenomenon Beyond Religious Considerations
- The Khemenet: Linking the Facts to the Legends
- PMN: Traces of Dalgarian Technologies
- Vessels and Energy Exhaustion: What the Dalgarians Knew
	Keep your studies secret, and reserve any question to Raein himself. 
Discretion is crucial.

Raein,
	Our latest observations confirmed our calculations. If we don’t do anything, our whole world will suffer, once again, a major extinction event within the next 5 years. 
	Time is absolutely critical. We must find a way to use the PMN once again. 
	Raein, I implore you, please expose our knowledge to the Queen. Let the truth be clear, and coordinate planet-scale action to find a potential candidate to operate the PMN! 
	The survival of everyone and everything depends on us. 
Efaryn

Raein, 
	We have set up our observation points in the planned location in order to triangulate our observations. 
	The astronomical lenses are set up, so it should be no trouble to determine how much time we have left before Kayosva becomes a serious threat to us. 
	How is your search going? We need Vessels for the PMN sooner rather than later.
Efaryn

Efaryn, 
	We found a great candidate! Their potential for sorcery is absolutely terrifying, and they have the physical abilities to match. There is a very good chance for them to be the perfect Vessel. 
	We set them on the path of the trial. The hope is that their thirst for power may lead them to believe in the Khemenet prophecy. 
	So far, our strategy is to not intervene. We will let them complete the whole trial by themselves. And they seem to be doing excellent so far.
Raein

Efaryn, 
	The Queen is too obsessed with Purity to ever come around to the reality of our situation. Even basic astronomy, as we understand it, would be considered heretical at the royal court.
	Imagine trying to explain to the Queen what a neutron star is when her understanding of the world is that people are either pure in the absence of Sorcery, or corrupted by it? Our studies put us thousands of years ahead of the rest of Eraden thanks to the Dagarians. 
	I will not risk compromising our mission just to receive help from the Queen. Our vessel candidate is doing exactly what we need, and does not suspect a thing, as far as I know.
Raein
Less Than  A Few Years Left

Raein, 
	How are your candidates coming? Our calculation are... alarming.
	What we found is that we may have less than a few years to save Byeth. It is absolutely CRITICAL that we put all efforts in this endeavour. 
Efaryn

Raein, 
	The guards mentioned that they have spotted the presence of Wildfolk in our vicinity, and that The Eye has been spotted in another Dalgarian Ruin somewhere. 
	My concerns is that they will compromise our plan. Both entities are Khemenet believers, although, in very different ways. We should stay alert. To keep a low profile, we will move our camp regularly, and I will make sure our letters remain private.
Efaryn

Raein, 
	We discovered an abandoned camp of The Eye, and some artefacts they left behind. 
	I believe they may be trying to stop the Khemenet cycle. At least, their fanatical texts seem to suggest so. We also found pendants that seem to display a symbolic representation of Kayosva.
	 Since we know their leader briefly accessed our Society's archive while he was an apprentice there, it is possible that he created a whole new belief system cobbled together from bits of information she gathered here and there.

I fear she may know more that she shows. Could she be trying to prevent you-know-what for the sake of her own Sorcery powers? If so, that would be both foolish, and a terrible threat to our mission. 
	We must warn the Queen at once of the threat they pose, but without going into details... for reasons you understand. 
Efaryn
Raein - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 2 (1/2)

Raein Valentir / The Gate Island Journal / Day 2
	We have received a Crystal Core. It’s just one, but even that is a minor miracle. I suppose that since the Queen needs us now, she is willing to turn her head at some things, at least more than she usually would. 
	Unfortunately, I tried to activate the Monolith by placing the Crystal Core on the receptacle, but it did not work. The fact that I lack any ability for Sorcery might be the problem.
Raein - Journal On The Gate Island - Day 2 (2/2)

I believe old Dalgarian technologies can often track one’s Sorcery potential and react accordingly. I need to find a way to bring a Sorcerer here without the suspicion of the Eraden soldiers. 
	If the Monolith would work, I wonder if our theory about merging Crystal Cores could also be tested with it. But I would require a second, different Crystal Core for such a test.

The second Khemenet emerged victorious over the Hekalis, sustaining only minor injuries and showing no signs of exhaustion. They appeared as if the outcome of this trial was inevitable, written in the eternal memories of the Layak Naa since the dawn of time. 
	After a single meditative stare at the room, the second Khemenet slowly approached the Crystal Core attached to the head of the gigantic creature they had just slain effortlessly. And with a single flick of their hand, they detached it as if they were Zankalarim incarnate. 
	They smiled as the ecstatic crowd seemed to start to believe that they were indeed the new Khemenet. As if this demonstration of power left no doubt in their minds that they had returned once again to save us all.
The Night Of The Ten Thousand Years (1/2)
The Night Of The Ten Thousand Years (2/2)

Thousands of believers were united, circling day and night around the resting Th'a Valneya, where the Khemenet was silently preparing to share their wisdom before the Nights of the Ten Thousand Years would again commence. 
	Many were weeping, unable to contain their fear and their sadness, mourning already their Khemenet, mourning the one who brought so much harmony to their lives and to the lives of their ancestors.

Yet there they were, still present in their lives, still teaching one last lesson before they would once again lay to rest, diffusing into the Layak Naa and the Mayak Naa both, restoring the balance of the Universe. 
	As they saw their followers weeping and wailing, the Khemenet took the Sword of Naa in his hand and lifted it above his head. Conjuring mental projections, he sent the following words: "Do not worry, my children, for the Sword of Naa will exist as long as Dalgarians live. I shall disappear, but I shall appear again." 
	Such is the eternal cycle of harmony.

And as the second Khemenet entered the Aminira Nar Kayosvam, all went silent, carefully observing every step they took. 
As the procession advanced deeper into the temple, they soon found themselves right in front of the Sword of Naa. 
All the followers seemed to have stopped breathing for a moment. This was the moment at which everything could change.

If the candidate before them was indeed the Khemenet, then they would be able to grasp the sword, and by transferring their Sorceryal energy into it, unite the Mayak Naa and the Layak Naa. 
And indeed, it was the Khemenet. 
With a gentle hand, they reached for the sword and gripped it firmly. It felt as if all the Sorceryal energy of the world was channelling through them at that moment.

As the Sorceryal power seemed to reach impossible levels, the Khemenet withdrew the sword from its mount, and looked back at their followers with a smile: 
There was not a single doubt, they were the Khemenet, and the Sword of Naa had granted them a thousand years of reign over the Jikarazins, bringing peace and harmony for the centuries to come. Tears of joy were seen and heard, and soon the entire world could feel what they so fervently believed: 
The Khemenet had returned to save them!

While Kayosva shone brightly upon us, we knew that the Khemenet would soon return to be among us. 
	The nights were as warm as the days, and the daylight was blinding. The Jikarazins grew stronger each day, and the chaos they created was ever-expanding, but everyone knew in their hearts that this was only a sign that the Khemenet would soon be back. 
	They all knew that salvation was upon them, and no misfortune could shake their faith.
The Gift Of The Sword Of Naa
