Byeth Page I 
	As I grow older and see instability and uncertainty foment all around Byeth, I have decided to put to paper some of my adventures and keep a journal of my thoughts and observations from a life of travel around the world. 
	I have been living on this island for some years now, far from the hustle and bustle of the mainland. 
	How the night sky here never gets old. The stars twinkle gently, Oron drifts silently by in all its splendour and the Azure Star guides the way for sailors all over Byeth. What makes her burn so bright?

Byeth Page II 
	The Guild posting to Eraden was never my desire to begin, as I have always felt more comfortable at sea, living the life of adventure. But as the years have passed and my body has fails me through age, I have found peace operating my own little patch of land here. A lifestyle reduction from my barony perhaps, hah! 
	But nonetheless, I have found a life of tranquillity here while I can still be of some service in semi-retirement as a broker of information and goods. 
	Operating the edge of the storm is enough to keep main sails away, which is perfect for those who require discretion. Meanwhile, those who are foolhardy enough to try and penetrate the storm end up as a flotsam for stocking my shelves.

Byeth Page III 
	I had the perfect view of a shipwreck just this morning, right after dawn. From the wreckage that washed ashore I can tell it was a sloop sailing from Khar-Tib, almost certainly heading to Eraden. 
	The crew must have foolishly sailed through the night and by sunrise found themselves much to close to the storm to avert course. I have witnessed grander expeditions to the Dalgarian Tower and every fleet ends up as kindling the moment it hits the storm's boundary. I can only assume then that this sloop wandering into the storm was accidental, if not suicidal.

Byeth Page IV
	The flotsam was slim pickings however... no wares, no manifest, skeleton crew... Indeed the ship was too small to be considered a trading vessel. Messengers then? The sailors had no distinguishing marks save for one man who bared a tattooed marking of an eye on his wrist. 
	Is this the infamous "Eye" that the locals in Eraden fear? What business would they have in Khar-Tib either way?

Sentara Page I 
	The white sands and crystal blue oceans of Sentara... how I miss them! I have been feeling particularly nostalgic lately. Perhaps it is the turmoil that is beginning to foment on the mainland of Eraden that has me wishing to beeline back to Sentari shores. 
	Sometimes I will perch on the rock to stare out at the ocean and remember it all. I recall my barony along the coast, with fields of wild lilac growing fresh under the Sentari sun. How it seems like another life now! 
	Of course, those days have long gone since the War of Sails took everything. With the subsequent consolidation of power beneath the Grand Doge, there was no barony left to speak of... or life for that matter. Career prospects are not great for enemies of the State...

Sentara Page II 
	For that reason I feel a great loyalty to Ramayan and the Guild who offered me a second chance. Growing the Guild from humble beginnings, gaining power, respect and influence against adversity and in the face of the old guards. Hah, so much so that as a younger man I always anticipated a day where the Guild would be so strong that we would cast anchor at Port-Market, storm the palace and restore our nation. 
	However I do not dwell on such fantasies now. There was once a time that the fury in my heart would keep me warm on cold nights at sea, but that fire has long extinguished. Bitterness and hate are the vial of poison meant for your enemies but you drink yourself, and with age comes the realization than change is a part of life.

Madlu Page I 
	Of all the nations of Byeth, the people of Madlu are the most recluse and isolationist. Unsurprising, given their trepidation to interact with foreigners who willingly consume the very crystal shard that devastated their civilization. 
	Yet a paradox exists, for despite the disdain and apprehension towards the crystal shard, the Madene are not above using them for their technological advantages; indeed their technological utilization is as ingenious as one will ever see in the lands of Byeth!

Madlu Page II 
	As a younger man, my journey north was once and once only. We had heard tales of the Madene and their achievements, so the Guild's incentive was to open a dialogue with these people in an attempt to for crystal trade and knowledge. How naive we were! 
	Although the Madene are spread out in sparse settlements across the North-Eastern islands, their capital metropolis is located along the coast of the larger continent. Our unwelcome arrival was met with immediate suspicion and our ship was refused docking permissions, leaving us marooned on the freezing ocean. However, after several days of tense negotiation, Ramayan managed to gain us temporary access to the city. A magnificent city indeed!

Madlu Page III 
       The cold on the northern continents are bitter beyond belief, yet the Madene carve out a miraculous existence here through their utilization of the crystal; lantern lined roads cast a soft crystal light that emits heat. The crystal studded outer walls of their cities crackle with pulsating energy to keep savage snow beasts at bay. How do they harness this power? Where do they source their crystals?

Madlu Page IV
	 Our prying was quickly met with hostility; we learned that the ingestion of crystal for personal sorcery is the highest form of taboo and Madene society will not touch it. It is the corruption they fear, no doubt. One need not look further than Rakta to see the corrupting effects of the crystal on humankind, yet here the Madene harness the power freely in their technologies; how strange! In what manner have the Madene made the crystal safe for utilitarian purposes? Where did they learn such knowledge?

Madlu Page V 
	After two short days of sour looks and stonewalling, our party was expelled from the metropolis, no richer or wiser than we had arrived. The frostbite that took my hand on the return journey will forever serve as a permanent reminder of this failed expedition and the secrets of Madlu remain undisclosed.

Rakta Page I 
	Snow topped highlands, swamp filled lowlands, with sorcery corrupted samurai everywhere in between. If you wish to visit another world you do not need to travel to Oron, as Rakta will do. 
	The Raike's aptitude for the crystal shard is insatiable. The shard is supreme, and magic is utilized in all aspects of society. Naturally this makes Rakta are lucrative candidate for Sentari middlemen who deal in shard peddling. But the crystal dependence makes them unreliable, twitchy... To travel there on business, one must keep a hand on their sword at all times.

Rakta Page II 
	Of the several Guild expeditions I travelled there we always took the western coast, not only as the most direct route from Sentara, but blissfully the route is without any interference from Eradian patrols. The sun-kissed coastal views of Sentara quickly turn to plains of ice as you enter the waters of Rakta. 
	There are no direct ports to any Rakta cities, so expedition by land is always necessary. Further inland the country is dense snow topped mountain, though the country is wetter than you would expect. Much of the trekking is across swampy lowlands with strange flora and fungi, and one must always be vigilant for Bullywug in these terrain.

Rakta Page III 
	Eventually, the expedition will take your upward as you ascend the mountains to find the Raike cities, though cities is perhaps too strong a word... Most Raike peasants live in clusters of tiny bamboo shelters scattered around the mountainsides, with narrow trails connecting the dwellings. In contrast the larger government military buildings are more imposing and elegant in architecture, often trimmed with gold and adorned with statues and tapestries that depict the glory years and rise of the Rakta Empire.

Rakta Page IV 
	To see how these sturdy people have somehow scratched out an existence in the mountains, inhabiting the sweet spot between frozen peaks and swampy lowlands... it is quite an impressive sight! But famine is ripe... What little farmable soil the Raike have is insufficient to support their population.

Rakta Page V
	The mountains of Rakta are ripe with gold veins, but gold cannot be eaten, and the Raike reliance on the crystal has left them isolated for allies. Embargoed from Eraden, Sentara remains their only trading partner for food and resources. Indeed there are few outside of Sentara who would even be willing to trade with the Raike while they are so predisposed with crystal consumption, for they are a menacing sight... their eyes completely blackened, with dark veins exposed beneath a deathly pale skin tone.

Rakta Page VI 
	It has been many years since my last expedition to Rakta. The latest rumours is that the Emperor has crossed the mountain and begun to make moves on the arable border lands of Eraden. Skirmishes have been reported along the northern borders, where Rakta warriors have displaced the native Wildfolk there, pushing them further south into Eraden. Surely this will be another friction that will no doubt end in bloodshed!

Khar-Tib Page I 
	It is impossible to paint Khar-Tib with one broad stroke, as the nation is so diversified in tribes and culture that indeed it is more like a loose collective of mini-nations held together by a broad cultural semblance. 
	My expeditions to the tribes of Khar-Tib were always fraught with high adventure and excitement, as the desert lands themselves are so ancient and filled with mystery. Blazing hot days and freezing nights. Golden sands as far as the eye can see. And each tribe with its own local warlord and story to tell.

Khar-Tib Page II 
	Iron and wood were always popular trades on the Khar-Tib continent, with exotic fruits and textiles being the return. I always enjoyed the bustle of commerce in Khar-Tib markets, watching the locals barter their wares and ride their strange humped horses, but the real spectacle of these people was in their crossing the deserts. Traversing the desert by foot or animal is impossible due to the presence of massive snake-like beasts that lurk beneath the sand, so the locals employ precarious looking skimmers to sail across sand. A ship that sails on land... what a marvel!

Khar-Tib Page III 
	Khar-Tib is experiencing a state of change however. There are whispers of a powerful warlord who rose from relative obscurity to become a unifying force across the nation, persuading, coercing, and subjugating the fragmented tribes into one consolidated power. The existence of this new unified Khar-Tib under one banner has agitated Eraden's fragile trading positions with the Khar-Tib tribes and sparked rumours of war. After all, a unified Khar-Tib means an existential threat to Eraden's position as leading power.

Khar-Tib Page IV
	Who is this warlord I wonder? Rumours are surely exaggerated... they say he is ten feet tall with the strength of a hundred warriors, a devil among men. Unlikely, but they also say his rise to power was supported by a group of Warlock known only as The Dust. Perhaps then there is some truth to his power.

Eraden Page I 
	The mainland of Eraden is a beehive of activity these days since the recent discovery of Dalgarian ruins in the mountains has ignited what folk are calling the Crystal Hunt. The promise of Dalgarian crystals has drawn adventurers from all over Byeth, including of course the Guild. 
	In response, the Queen of Eraden has been swift and brutal in her crackdown on such prospectors, trying her best to strangle the distribution of crystals and by extension sorcery.

Eraden Page II 
	The existence of the Eradian Thralls show that they are not above using sorcery, yet only when tempered as the belief is that excess sorcery will cause corruption of the soul and destruction of one's humanity. This has been the way of Eraden for many centuries, though the historical origins of this is unknown to me. I have seen first hand that their is truth to the claims made by Eraden; one need not look further than Rakta!

Eraden Page III
	I suppose in a way Sentara should be grateful for the prohibition as the income from crystal brokering allows us to project influence far beyond our size or military capacity! 
	Regardless, the lack of personal sorcery has never stifled Eraden from becoming the largest military and cultural powerhouse in Byeth, not to mention the most cosmopolitan of all nations.

Eraden Page IV
	But is it right to restrict the common man from using sorcery for their benefit while sorcery is used to benefit of the crown? In my opinion, there is a hypocrisy at work here which is that rules do not apply to the powerful who wish to remain in power.

Graystone Page I 
	As you travel from Sentara to Eraden or back again you must sail the strait between the arm of Eraden and the island of Graystone. 
	Since all vessels must pass this way, Sentari Captains utilize the strait to hang the bodies of traitors, mutineers and thieves from the cliffs to serve as a grim warning to all sailors who pass through. However these bodies of the damned are never removed, so over the decades the strait has become a macabre display. Sentari locals attribute this to the curse that befalls Graystone.

Graystone Page II 
	The island of Graystone has been on my mind lately as I contemplate my half-adventures, unfinished business so to speak. Long before my involvement with the Guild I travelled to Graystone on behalf of the Grand Doge of Sentara, on a surveying mission. The island is overgrown, long deserted, but when some local explorers found crystal deposits on the island it piqued the interest of the Doge to lay claim and secure the island.

Graystone Page III 
	We arrived with a small cohort of men for what we assumed would be nothing more than a few weeks of hacking through dense vegetation and sleeping rough. Imagine our surprise when at the heart of the island we discovered a stone stair, descending into the black. The entrance was completely innocuous, concealed by overgrown thorny vines to the point it was invisible if not for chance and dumb luck leading us to notice it.

Graystone Page IV 
	We lit the torches and descended deep below the surface. The ruins below were a series of damp passages with strange fungi and mosses growing in the cracks of the stone walls. The place had an ominous feeling to it and the deeper we delved the walls became lined with what looked like embedded sarcophagi which we dared not disturb. 
	The passage led us to a large chamber to what appeared to be a Great Hall. A long rotting table lay as the centrepiece to a room with crumbling pillars. We cast the torchlight to try and get a better understanding our surroundings when from the darkness shambled creatures as we have never seen before... men, or the remains of men, with their leathered skin hanging in tatters, putrefied organs on display.

Graystone Page V 
	Several of our soldiers immediately turned and fled in terror. Those of us who drew swords somehow mustered the courage to stand against these monstrosities, but were horrified to find the creatures seemingly immune to our blades. 
	I witnessed firsthand these monsters incur severed limbs, yet pain was not registered and their assault continued unperturbed. 
	After several of my sailors were butchered by rusted blades the ranks broke and we had no option but to flee from this tomb.

Graystone Page VI 
	The initial report to the Grand Doge was met with disbelief but subsequent expeditions to the island were met similar fates. Wave after wave of Sentari soldiers have entered the tomb never to return, with reports now saying the dead have ascended above ground in startling numbers to walk the island itself, making it impossible to establish any safe forward bases there. 
	This island will haunt my curiosity forever! What manner of sorcery is this? What lurks in the deepest part of these tombs? How I wish to know!

Eastern Rainforests Page I 
	Now I am old, I feel my adventuring days are behind me. A regret I shall carry is that my adventures never took me to eastern rainforests in the lands known as the The Forgotten Continent. My grandfather was one such adventurer to have travelled there in his youth and his stories always stayed with me. He told harrowing tales of danger and disaster, where the majority of his crew succumbed to the terrors of the land itself. I wish to put to paper the story my grandfather told me of these people.

Eastern Rainforests Page II 
	History chronicles that the continent was once the homeland of the Madlu nation centuries ago, lush with rainforests, teaming with life. At this time the Madene were a forest dwelling people, powerful sorcerers who were able to shape the lands themselves. 
	But as the legend goes, over time the lands themselves grew hostile to its inhabitants... corruption grew, the forests twisted and gnarled, creatures became deformed and rabid, until all that was left were mockeries of the fauna and flora that once existed there. The Madene reportedly blamed crystal sorcery as the origin of corruption, vowing never to utilize such sorcery again.

Eastern Rainforests Page III 
	Facing a creeping extinction in their homeland, the Maadene were forced into migration. Receiving no amnesty from Khar-Tib, the Madene were forced north into the Frozen Wastes. Their survival would have been surely impossible if not for their magnificent technologies that allowed them to persevere the freezing cold and giant beasts that lurked in the snowstorms. 
	But therein lies the irony! Their technological dependence on the crystal meant their very survival.

items.name: Baron's Hat
items.description: This does not belong to you!

items.name: Health potion
items.description: A wound-healing liquid concoction imbued with magic. Its healing properties are scarcely understood, but it is said that excessive ingestion can drive one mad.

items.name: Bow
items.description: A well crafted bow, excellent for making distant and accurate shots by skilled users.

items.name: War Bow
items.description: A composite bow able to loose arrows with more power than typical bows. Suited especially well for warfare and stopping distant enemies dead in their tracks.

items.name: Arrow
items.description: A well made, general purpose arrow. Very effective at ranged attacks against soft targets, but is versatile enough to penetrate some armor.

items.name: Bodkin Arrow
items.description: An arrow of war, designed to penetrate armor. Rather expensive but necessary to stop an approaching army.

items.name: Arrow Quiver
items.description: A well made, general purpose arrows. Very effective at ranged attacks against soft targets, but is versatile enough to penetrate some armor.

items.name: Felling Axe
items.description: An axe once used to cut down trees. The wide blade alone makes it not suitable for combat, but it has also developed quite a bit of rust.

items.name: Bearded Axe
items.description: A fighting axe with extra blade length, requiring less accuracy and causing more damage. Axes like this are particularly good at penetrating soft armors.

items.name: Old Hatchet
items.description: An ancient axe head restored back to use with newer fittings. Its origin has been lost to time but it still finds use in combat today.

items.name: Knightly Axe
items.description: A battle axe made for Eraden horse mounted knights. Extremely versatile and balanced for great handling.

items.name: Battle Axe
items.description: A refined soldier’s axe used specifically to defeat armored foes. The added back spike gives it even more versatility in the fray of combat.

items.name: Brigand Axe
items.description: A simple weapon to make made terrifying by its chopping ability. The added shaft length is more than enough to keep enemies from getting too close. Has earned a reputation as a bandit weapon.

items.name: Bardiche
items.description: A long axe with a large cleaving blade, making it easier to aim devastating cuts. Its extra weight makes it both unwieldy and more destructive.

items.name: Royal Guard Halberd
items.description: An axe issued to elite guards of the Eraden Kingdom. Excellent for defense and offense thanks to its added spike and back blade.

items.name: Tribal Axe
items.description: An old war axe originating from one of many tribes of centuries ago. Formidable still, especially against enemies lacking armor.

items.name: Rusty Cleaver
items.description: A meat cutting tool that has been long forgotten. While it’s no longer suitable for working with food, it may still find use in its original purpose.

items.name: Imperial Dagger
items.description: An old, restored dagger from the First Empire. Very reliable for its time to still see use today.

items.name: Eradian Dagger
items.description: A lightweight and multipurpose sidearm favored for its utility. Considered to be a mandatory tool on the battlefield for every soldier. A widely available design throughout Eraden.

items.name: Combat Dagger
items.description: While many daggers are designed with utility in mind, this dagger’s strong pommel and large guard are intended for hand to hand combat.

items.name: Noble’s Dagger
items.description: A dagger favored by the nobility of the Eraden Kingdom. While of exquisite quality, it is rarely ever used by nobles except as an accessory.

items.name: Winged Spear
items.description: A winged hunting spear specializing in swift, short thrusts. The wings help prevent deep penetration which can make withdrawal more difficult.

items.name: Bladed Staff
items.description: An unorthodox weapon from Khar-Tib. Said to be used for a form of dancing rather than combat, but the blades are sharp and high quality nevertheless.

items.name: Crow’s Beak
items.description: A great warpick specializing in defeating armored soldiers. The pick can penetrate any armor with enough force, but requires a high degree of skill to aim the point on such a long shaft.

items.name: Wooden Club
items.description: Little more than a well chosen tree branch, yet still formidable enough to make a foe think twice about approaching.

items.name: Mallet
items.description: A tool for staking wooden posts into the ground. Like any blunt object, it has its uses in combat.

items.name: Improvised Staff
items.description: A type of staff commonly created and used by outlaws for unsanctioned sorcery.

items.name: Druidic Staff
items.description: A ceremonial staff created by the Northern tribal Druids. The wood comes from a tree sacred to them, but the staff otherwise offers a basic level of sorcery channeling.

items.name: Rapier
items.description: A sword designed for dueling. It excels in exploiting weak points in armor but requires a skilled wielder.

items.name: Imperial Sword
items.description: Although centuries old, swords from the First Empire remain useful and can still be found commonly around Eraden.

items.name: Eradian Sword
items.description: A versatile weapon of war carried by many trained soldiers in the Eraden kingdom.

items.name: Riding Sword
items.description: An excellent short sword favored by horse riders for its ease of use and mobility in a single hand.

items.name: Burial Sword
items.description: One of many swords unearthed from graves from the First Empire. Preserved well enough to still be of use today.

items.name: Longsword
items.description: A sword with a long, two handed handle, giving the user more agility to maneuver the blade. One of the most versatile weapons in the kingdom.

items.name: War Sword
items.description: A large longsword designed for battlefield use. Packs a punch and is very versatile thanks to its length and agility.

items.name: La Baguette
items.description: Forged in the ovens of a legendary breadmaker known only in folktales as KospY

items.name: Wrist Blade
items.description: An assassination blade from Khar-Tib. The wrist mount allows the user to stab with much more force than normal.

items.name: Torch
items.description: A light source that can be ignited by fire.

items.name: Blacksmith Hammer
items.description: A small but surprisingly heavy and unwieldy hammer. Not a great choice for combat but can still deliver serious damage.

items.name: Iron Mace
items.description: A simple yet effective club reinforced with iron. It’s shaped in such a way to deliver stronger, focused impacts against plated armor.

items.name: Flanged Mace
items.description: A mace with a design that strikes fear even into the most heavily armored soldiers.

items.name: War Maul
items.description: Derived from tools but designed for combat, this maul can crush through armor and bones alike.

items.name: Great Mace
items.description: A rather large mace given to specialist soldiers to defeat heavily armored forces.

items.name: Studded Cudgel
items.description: A reinforced wooden club. As simple as it is effective.

items.name: Knightly Warpick
items.description: A terrifyingly powerful bludgeon with a spike capable of penetrating even plate armor. Favored by knights of Eraden for use on horseback.

items.name: Arrowhead Spear
items.description: A deceptively simple one handed spear used with a shield on the battlefield.

items.name: Sentry’s Spear
items.description: A two-handed spear with a sword-like blade used by royal guards. Though two handed, it’s short enough to be used in close combat and can keep a number of foes at bay.

items.name: Hayfork
items.description: If you find yourself in an unfortunate enough situation to use this as a weapon, aim for the eyes.

items.name: Javelin
items.description: A restored spear originating from the First Empire. The exact intent has been lost to time, but it works surprisingly well for as old as it is.

items.name: Master’s Staff
items.description: A dangerous staff containing a rare and powerful crystal. Said to be hazardous to wield in any hands except that of a master of sorcery.

items.name: Thrall’s Staff
items.description: A staff of deliberately limited power given to sorcerers subservient to the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Sorcerer’s Staff
items.description: An uncompromising staff allowing sorcerers to channel their power through its crystal with incredible efficiency. A tool feared and hated by the Eradian people.

items.name: Ritual Sword
items.description: An ancient tribal blade scavenged from ruins. The original use is believed to be for tradition rather than combat since the weight makes it difficult to wield.

items.name: Claymore
items.description: An intimidating battle sword with strong cultural roots. Seen in the hands of mercenaries and other small military bands.

items.name: Greatsword
items.description: An oversized sword used by specialist soldiers on the field. It tends to be more flashy than practical, however, it is quite intimidating.

items.name: Beheading Sword
items.description: A First Empire execution sword from an older era left to rust. Repurposed as a crude weapon, but the blood-corroded blade won’t provide much cutting power.

items.name: Highborn Greatsword
items.description: A large blade bestowed to heavily armored front line defenders. Without the need for a shield, their free hand helped to wield this beast of a sword.

items.name: Slaughter Sword
items.description: An incredible weapon only used by the most experienced soldiers. Long enough to keep spears at bay and fast enough to fend off a dozen enemies.

items.name: Lord’s Sword
items.description: A longsword worn by aristocracy of the Eraden Kingdom. Perfected for combat against other sword users. It doubles as a wearable work of art.

items.name: Old Warbrand
items.description: An ancient blade used by the First Empire. It was easy to produce and yet devastating against common soldiers, but this one has deteriorated with time.

items.name: Highborn Sword
items.description: A masterfully crafted sword made as a status symbol for Eraden nobility. Despite appearing somewhat decorative, the blade and material are of excellent quality rarely found in Eraden.

items.name: Ancient Seax
items.description: An unearthed ancient tribal weapon. No longer useful, but artifacts like this can be found somewhat commonly under the ground.

items.name: Throwing Dagger
items.description: A small, cheap blade, properly balanced for optimal throwing.

items.name: Rock
items.description: The simplest and most ancient weapon of all.

items.name: Throwing Dagger Pouch
items.description: Small, cheap blades, properly balanced for optimal throwing.

items.name: Bodkin Arrow Quiver
items.description: Arrows of war, designed to penetrate armor. Rather expensive but necessary to stop an approaching army.

items.name: Ancient Arrow Quiver
items.description: Arrows created from old, restored arrowheads found commonly in Eraden.

items.name: Oar
items.description: An old oar from a rowing boat

items.name: Leather Boots
items.description: Reliable traveling boots minimally reinforced with a leather greave. A decent compromise between mobility and protection.

items.name: Leather Bracer Left
items.description: A leather forearm wrap, often used to aid in archery but offers some wrist protection in combat.

items.name: Leather Bracer Right
items.description: A leather forearm wrap, often used to aid in archery but offers some wrist protection in combat.

items.name: Leather Helmet
items.description: A protective combat helmet effective at softening blows and mitigating cuts. Though not crafted from the best of materials, protecting one’s head is a must in combat.

items.name: Leather Gambeson
items.description: A protective combat vest effective at softening blows and mitigating cuts. A minimum requirement for protecting one’s vital organs in combat.

items.name: Leather Trousers
items.description: Trousers minimally reinforced with leather patches. A decent compromise between mobility and protection.

items.name: Sorcerer Boots
items.description: Simple boots worn by enthralled sorcerers of the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Sorcerer Hood
items.description: A hood worn by enthralled sorcerers of the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Sorcerer Glove Left
items.description: An unremarkable hand wrap that can allow unimpeded use of sorcery.

items.name: Sorcerer Glove Right
items.description: An unremarkable hand wrap that can allow unimpeded use of sorcery.

items.name: Sorcerer Jacket
items.description: A simple jacket worn by enthralled sorcerers of the Eraden Kingdom. Offers minor benefits to wielding sorcery.

items.name: Sorcerer Trousers
items.description: Simple pants worn by enthralled sorcerers of the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Eradian Shoes
items.description: Cloth town shoes worn commonly in Eraden.

items.name: Eradian Tunic
items.description: Common garb worn by Eraden townsfolk. Simple yet stylish.

items.name: Manchette Left
items.description: An accessory for tying down long loose sleeves, but on its own it makes a nice fashion statement.

items.name: Manchette Right
items.description: An accessory for tying down long loose sleeves, but on its own it makes a nice fashion statement.

items.name: Eradian Trousers
items.description: A simple pair of brown pants. May be helpful as to not betray one’s fear to their allies.

items.name: Tribal Sandals
items.description: Traditional leg wrapped sandals worn by the Northern tribes of Eraden.

items.name: Tribal Arm Wrap Left
items.description: An arm wrap that helps keep the wrist more sturdy during battle.

items.name: Tribal Arm Wrap Right
items.description: An arm wrap that helps keep the wrist more sturdy during battle.

items.name: Tribal Headband
items.description: A headband with cultural significance to the Northern tribes of Eraden.

items.name: Tribal Kilt
items.description: Cultural garb developed by the Northern tribes of Eraden. Proudly worn by gladiators that often fight for the enjoyment of it.

items.name: Tribal Spaulder
items.description: Cultural shoulder armor made for gladiators of the Northern tribes of Eraden.

items.name: Raider Greaves
items.description: Sturdy but cheaply put together leather combat boots reinforced with a shin plate.

items.name: Raider Glove Left
items.description: A fingerless leather glove, giving added grip stability to using weaponry without compromising on precision.

items.name: Raider Glove Right
items.description: A fingerless leather glove, giving added grip stability to using weaponry without compromising on precision.

items.name: Spiked Raider Glove Left
items.description: A fingerless leather glove, giving added grip stability to using weaponry without compromising on precision.

items.name: Raider Headband
items.description: A headband used to easily identify one’s allies in the fray of battle. Minimally protective but also keeps hair and sweat out of the eyes.

items.name: Raider Brigandine
items.description: A coat reinforced with small plates made out of ancient scrap metal scavenged throughout the land. Cheap and minimally effective, but far better than nothing.

items.name: Raider Trousers
items.description: Leather chausses created for tribal warriors, reinforced with ancient scrap metal scavenged throughout the land.

items.name: Raider Spaulder Left
items.description: Shoulder armor made out of chain. Surprisingly effective at protecting from slash attacks.

items.name: Raider Spaulder Right
items.description: Shoulder armor made out of chain. Surprisingly effective at protecting from slash attacks.

items.name: Raider Spaulders
items.description: Shoulder armor made out of chain. Surprisingly effective at protecting from slash attacks.

items.name: Worn Trousers
items.description: Trousers no longer suitable for a hard day’s work, but can still keep you modest.

items.name: Sleeveless Shirt
items.description: A simple undershirt worn by a variety of inhabitants around Eraden.

items.name: Worn Undershirt
items.description: A simple undershirt worn by a variety of inhabitants around Eraden.

items.name: Working Shirt
items.description: A simple undershirt worn by a variety of inhabitants around Eraden.

items.name: Laced Shirt
items.description: A simple undershirt worn by a variety of inhabitants around Eraden.

items.name: Plate Boots
items.description: Battlefield quality boots reinforced with sabatons to protect from any incoming damage to the toes.

items.name: Plate Vambrace Left
items.description: A protective forearm plate helpful in deflecting any wayward blows.

items.name: Plate Vambrace Right
items.description: A protective forearm plate helpful in deflecting any wayward blows.

items.name: Plate Barbute
items.description: A metal open face helmet that works wonders in deflecting slash attacks.

items.name: Chain Tabard
items.description: A chain tabard covered by a plate gorget, and worn on top of gambeson as well! Top quality armor that provides several layers of defense to vitals.

items.name: Plate Cuisse
items.description: Upper leg plates fastened to combat ready trousers. Protects what a shield may leave vulnerable.

items.name: Plate Pauldron Left
items.description: Shoulder plate armor, necessary to defend against blows deflecting off of one’s helmet.

items.name: Plate Pauldron Right
items.description: Shoulder plate armor, necessary to defend against blows deflecting off of one’s helmet.

items.name: Plate Pauldrons
items.description: Shoulder plate armor, necessary to defend against blows deflecting off of one’s helmet.

items.name: Sandals
items.description: The most ancient form of footwear available for a low, low price.

items.name: Ancient Arrow
items.description: An arrow created from old, restored arrowheads found commonly in Eraden.

items.name: Tribal Bow
items.description: A simple bow created for hunting. Easy to make, disposable, and not particularly well suited towards warfare.

items.name: Skinning Knife
items.description: A once useful tool that became rusted from neglect. It may still have use in desperate situations.

items.name: Falchion
items.description: An old falchion of Khar-Tib origin, often used in naval combat for defending against Sentari pirates.

items.name: Golden Chalice
items.description: A royal chalice of the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Ritual Chalice
items.description: A chalice with a now depleted crystal embedded in the stem, used by the Eye in sorcery rituals.

items.name: Bronze Goblet
items.description: An ancient trinket, not very valuable but quite durable and with some practical use.

items.name: Copper Coin
items.description: A form of currency used to trade in Eraden. Being made of a valuable metal, it has inherent value.

items.name: Silver Coin
items.description: A form of currency used in Eraden. The tails side depicts the crest of the Eraden Kingdom.

items.name: Gold Coin
items.description: A form of currency used in Eraden. The head depicts King Aldaric, first true King of Eraden.

items.name: Druidic Pendant
items.description: A bronze pendant carried by Druids of the Wildfolk as a symbol of wisdom and authority.

items.name: Royal Medallion
items.description: An Eraden Kingdom medallion worn by nobility as a show of loyalty.

items.name: Depleted Pendant
items.description: A formerly powerful crystal used to store magic, but now is depleted. An object like this is highly illegal in Eraden, but quite valuable.

items.name: Astarium Ingot
items.description: An extremely rare metal used to channel sorcery. Highly illegal to own or craft with in the land of Eraden.

items.name: Bronze Ingot
items.description: An ingot made out of bronze, easy to work with though somewhat outdated - the Wildfolk still find use for such metal.

items.name: Gold Ingot
items.description: A lustrous gold ingot, valued purely for its aesthetic qualities by the rich and powerful living in Eraden.

items.name: Silver Ingot
items.description: An ingot made out of silver. A valuable crafting metal in the land of Eraden.

items.name: King Aldaric Figure
items.description: A small statue of the King Aldaric, an emperor who once united Eraden.

items.name: Watchman Statuette
items.description: An Eraden Kingdom figure, representing the strength of the Eraden military.

items.name: Wildfolk Statuette
items.description: A statue of a war maiden, symbolizing the long lived resilience of the northern tribesmen.

items.name: Crystal Shard
items.description: A small, consumable crystal fragment, able to be used to improve sorcery.

items.name: Apple
items.description: Worm free and ready to eat.

items.name: Apple Core
items.description: The tough central part of an apple, containing the seeds

items.name: Zipline Wheel
items.description: A simple but useful device allowing the user to safely ride down zipline ropes. The speed of descent can be manipulated by moving.

items.name: Pitchfork
items.description: Incredibly effective against hay, leaves and manure. May be of some use in combat against humans as well, as peasants often have limited means to protect themselves from bandits.

items.name: Rake
items.description: A peasants tool for gathering grass and leaves. What more can truly be said about it?

items.name: Sickle
items.description: A farming device for reaping crop. May be able to reap other things as well.

items.name: Chicken Egg
items.description: A delicious, freshly laid, unfertilized chicken egg.

items.name: Bird Egg
items.description: A small bird egg. It wont provide much nutrition but the contents are quite delicious.

items.name: Seagull Egg
items.description: A rather fishy tasting egg laid by a gull. A delicacy for sure.

items.name: Hoe
items.description: A farming tool for working the soil. In skilled hands, it may also be of use in shaping the battlefield.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.description: A worn stone shattering tool. Can be quite difficult to aim against a flailing target.

items.name: Ancient Pickaxe
items.description: A pickaxe over thousands of years old, used by the Dalgarians. It’s embedded with a gravity crystal, making it easier to use when imbued with gravity.

items.name: Ancient Maul
items.description: A maul over thousands of years old, used by the Dalgarians. It’s embedded with a gravity crystal, making it easier to use when imbued with gravity.

items.name: Prismatic Crystal
items.description: A crystal with no sorcery infused into it.

items.name: Small Body Crystal Core
items.description: A small crystal core infused with Body sorcery.

items.name: Body Crystal Core
items.description: A crystal core infused with Body sorcery.

items.name: Great Body Crystal Core
items.description: A large crystal core infused with Body sorcery.

items.name: Small Fire Crystal Core
items.description: A small crystal core infused with Fire sorcery.

items.name: Fire Crystal Core
items.description: A crystal core infused with Fire sorcery.

items.name: Great Fire Crystal Core
items.description: A large crystal core infused with Fire sorcery.

items.name: Small Gravity Crystal Core
items.description: A small crystal core infused with Gravity sorcery.

items.name: Gravity Crystal Core
items.description: A crystal core infused with Gravity sorcery.

items.name: Great Gravity Crystal Core
items.description: A large crystal core infused with Gravity sorcery.

items.name: Small Lightning Crystal Core
items.description: A small crystal core infused with Lightning sorcery.

items.name: Lightning Crystal Core
items.description: A crystal core infused with Lightning sorcery.

items.name: Great Lightning Crystal Core
items.description: A large crystal core infused with Lightning sorcery.

items.name: Small Mind Crystal Core
items.description: A small crystal core infused with Mind sorcery.

items.name: Mind Crystal Core
items.description: A crystal core infused with Mind sorcery.

items.name: Great Mind Crystal Core
items.description: A large crystal core infused with Mind sorcery.

items.name: Bird Egg
items.description: A small bird egg. It wont provide much nutrition but the contents are quite delicious.

items.name: Chicken Egg
items.description: A delicious, freshly laid, unfertilized chicken egg.

items.name: Seagull Egg
items.description: A rather fishy tasting egg laid by a gull. A delicacy for sure.

items.name: Carl
items.description: Turtle Friend!

items.name: Poo
items.description: A pile of feces, high in fiber, does not taste too great.

items.name: Journal
items.description: Player Journal

items.name: Coin Bag
items.description: A collection of currency.

items.name: Crystal Bag
items.description: A collection of crystals.

items.name: Dalgarian Writing Tablet
items.description: An engraved stone tablet.

items.name: Druidic Moccasins
items.description: Thin cloth boots for sorcerers with tougher soles.

items.name: Druidic Manchette Left
items.description: Practical wrist garb originating from the Northern Tribes.

items.name: Druidic Manchette Right
items.description: Practical wrist garb originating from the Northern Tribes.

items.name: Druidic Circlet
items.description: An ornamental circlet worn by the untamed sorcerers of the Northern tribes.

items.name: Druidic Trousers
items.description: A simple yet practical pair of pants made by the Druids of the Northern tribes.

items.name: Druidic Cloak
items.description: Sorcerer garb made by the Northern tribes of Eraden. Their use of sorcery is believed to be entwined with their ancient naturalistic beliefs.

items.name: Blackened Greaves
items.description: Boots crafted out of articulating metal plates to retain flexibility. Bestowed to elite members of The Eye.

items.name: Blackened Cuirass
items.description: Chest armor bestowed to gentry of The Eye. Worn on top of several layers of additional armor. Almost indestructible.

items.name: Blackened Gauntlet Left
items.description: Gauntlets crafted out of articulating metal plates to retain flexibility. Bestowed to elite members of The Eye.

items.name: Blackened Gauntlet Right
items.description: Gauntlets crafted out of articulating metal plates to retain flexibility. Bestowed to elite members of The Eye.

items.name: Blackened Armet
items.description: A plate helmet with a visor, made to leave no gaps for arrows or spear points to enter.

items.name: Blackened Cuisse
items.description: Protective leg armor made out of sturdy but flexible metal plates.

items.name: Blackened Pauldron Left
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Blackened Pauldron Right
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Blackened Spaulder Left
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Blackened Spaulder Right
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Blackened Pauldrons
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Blackened Spaulders
items.description: Shaped plate shoulder armor, very effective at protecting from a variety of damage.

items.name: Marauder Greaves
items.description: High quality boots reinforced with boiled leather plates. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers.

items.name: Marauder Cuirass
items.description: Hardened leather chest armor worn over gambeson. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers. Cost effective yet very protective.

items.name: Marauder Vambrace Left
items.description: A glove reinforced with boiled leather plates. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers.

items.name: Marauder Vambrace Right
items.description: A glove reinforced with boiled leather plates. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers.

items.name: Marauder Helmet
items.description: A hardened leather helmet that also hides one’s identity while protecting the face. Has a deliberately menacing look to it.

items.name: Marauder Cuisse
items.description: Hardened leather plates fastened to quilted trousers. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers.

items.name: Marauder Pauldrons
items.description: Thick boiled leather shoulder armor worn to block incoming strikes to the upper body. Armor created by the Eye to compete with the gear used by Eraden Kingdom soldiers.

items.name: Acolyte Doublet
items.description: A shirt worn by sorcerers of the Eye. The fabric is meticulously imbued with shard dust to enhance the sorcery of the user.

items.name: Acolyte Boots
items.description: Boots worn by sorcerers of the Eye.  Very nimble yet protective.

items.name: Acolyte Glove Left
items.description: A glove worn by sorcerers of the Eye. Made to not impede the use of magic.

items.name: Acolyte Glove Right
items.description: A glove worn by sorcerers of the Eye. Made to not impede the use of magic.

items.name: Acolyte Cowl
items.description: A hood worn by sorcerers of the Eye.

items.name: Acolyte Trousers
items.description: Pants worn by sorcerers of the Eye. Very nimble yet protective.

items.name: Old Maul
items.description: An ancient hammer head restored into a useful tool. Not built for battle yet it can be quite effective against plate armor.

items.name: Sword of Naa
items.description:
Darkness and chaos! The endless war! Jikarazins! Oh Kayosva!
We Implore You, Grant Us Harmony!
Oh Khemenet, summon the Sword of Naa!

items.name: Ancient Shovel
items.description: A shovel over thousands of years old, used by the Dalgarians. It’s embedded with a gravity crystal, making it easier to use when imbued with gravity.

items.name: Wooden Targe
items.description: A small battle shield used to protect the hands.

items.name: Infantry Shield
items.description: A small shield allowing the user to retain full mobility of their weapon.

items.name: Duelist's Buckler
items.description: A sturdy yet light weight shield made for single combat.

items.name: Tribal Shield
items.description: A medium wooden shield used on the front lines of battle. Favored especially by less-armored fighters for the cheap added protection.

items.name: Watchman Shield
items.description: A front line shield good for blocking arrows and weapon attacks with ease. A much cheaper alternative to buying armor.

items.name: Partisan Shield
items.description: A heavy plated shield, offering incredible durability and protection, especially against projectiles.

items.name: Partial Map
items.description: A map with partial information locating a Dalgarian Ruin.

items.name: Patchwork Glove Right
items.description: A glove fashioned from scrap cloth. Will not keep your hand warm but may improve charisma.

items.name: Patchwork Glove Left
items.description: A glove fashioned from scrap cloth. Will not keep your hand warm but may improve charisma.

items.name: Waist Wrap
items.description: A patchwork cloth wrapped around the waist to keep you modest while preserving the gentle feel of the breeze.

items.name: Scarf
items.description: An extremely fashionable neck garment. It does however smell a little.

items.name: Arm Wrap Right
items.description: Simple wrist protection made from a strip of leather. Could very possibly save your life, maybe!

items.name: Arm Wrap Left
items.description: Simple wrist protection made from a strip of leather. Could very possibly save your life, maybe!

items.name: Shoulder Plates
items.description: Small shoulder plates improvised from scraps of hard leather. Better than nothing.

items.name: Shoulder Plate Right
items.description: A small shoulder plate improvised from a scrap of hard leather. Better than nothing.

items.name: Shoulder Plate Left
items.description: A small shoulder plate improvised from a scrap of hard leather. Better than nothing.

items.name: Dalgarian Relic
items.description: A long forgotten relic with an unknown purpose. May be quite valuable to archaeologists.

items.name: Sunderer
items.description: A greatsword build for maximizing hewing damage and nothing else. Used by the more daring individuals of Raike infantry, as it could not be wielded with a shield, nor keep the wielder at a safe distance from the target.

items.name: Raike Sword
items.description: A culturally significant sword from Rakta used by elite warriors. According to Raike law, it is not to be drawn without the intent to kill.

items.name: Sword Catcher
items.description: A dagger designed to catch and deflect longer swords. Used by extremely skilled Raike spies that couldn’t be seen with larger weapons.

items.name: Cleaving Staff
items.description: A typical, yet versatile Raike warfare weapon. An excellent balance between reach and slashing power when on the battlefield.

items.name: Hand Scythe
items.description: A common improvised weapon among the Raike lower class, desperate to defend themselves against bandits and other threats.

items.name: Great Iron
items.description: An armor crushing club designed to take out Elite Raike soldiers. It’s very heavy, sometimes used with gravity sorcery to lighten it.

items.name: Throwing Star
items.description: A Raike spy tool used to distract, harm and kill enemy soldiers unaware, or as a surprise attack during a fight. Considered unsportsmanlike by the Raike elite.

items.name: Throwing Star Pouch
items.description: A Raike spy tool used to distract, harm and kill enemy soldiers unaware, or as a surprise attack during a fight. Considered unsportsmanlike by the Raike elite.

items.name: Double Crystal Staff
items.description: A sorcery staff used by skilled Raike warrior monks, both as a melee weapon and an instrument of sorcery. An unorthodox weapon, as using two crystals effectively is quite difficult for most.

items.name: Raike Elite Helmet
items.description: A helmet donned by elite Raike soldiers. The mask resembles a terrifying creature from Rakta.

items.name: Raike Elite Bracer (L)
items.description: High quality, ornate forearm armor worn by elite Raike soldiers.

items.name: Raike Elite Bracer (R)
items.description: High quality, ornate forearm armor worn by elite Raike soldiers.

items.name: Raike Elite Breastplate
items.description: High quality, ornate chest armor worn by elite Raike soldiers.

items.name: Raike Elite Breeches
items.description: High quality, ornate leg armor worn by elite Raike soldiers.

items.name: Raike Elite Greaves
items.description: High quality, ornate footwear worn by elite Raike soldiers.

items.name: Raike Elite Pauldrons
items.description: High quality, ornate shoulder armor worn by elite Raike soldiers.

waves.title: Duel
waves.description: A duel with friendly opponents to help get your bearings.

waves.title: Outnumbered
waves.description: Taking multiple opponents at once requires more awareness. Watch your back during combat.

waves.title: Archer Combat
waves.description: Archers will be a constant threat while you deal with approaching opponents. Chose how you manage them carefully.

waves.title: Standard
waves.description: Fight against every enemy type of this faction.

waves.title: Standard
waves.description: Fight against every enemy type of this faction.

waves.title: Melee Only
waves.description: Fight against only enemies that use melee weapons.

waves.title: Ranged
waves.description: Standard wave, but with higher rates of ranged enemies such as archers and sorcerers.

waves.title: Simple
waves.description: Fight against the common enemy types within this faction. Less sorcerers and heavily armored enemies.

waves.title: Swordsman Brawl
waves.description: A fight with enemies only wielding swords.

waves.title: Defend VIP (Hard)
waves.description: A 1 vs. 30 assassination attempt. Defend a VIP from the Eye!

waves.title: Defend VIP
waves.description: A 1 vs. 20 assassination attempt. Defend a VIP from the Eradian Kingdom!

waves.title: Defend Townsfolk
waves.description: A 10 vs. 30 invasion. Defend townsfolk from the Eye!

waves.title: Progressive Duel
waves.description: Duel against enemies from every faction from weak to strong.

waves.title: Progressive Gauntlet (Melee)
waves.description: A large enemy wave containing progressively difficult melee enemies from every faction, but they only want to kill you.

waves.title: Progressive Gauntlet
waves.description: A 60 enemy wave containing progressively difficult enemies from every faction, but they only want to kill you.

waves.title: Circle of Death
waves.description: A duel against many opponents. As a sign of respect between fighters, you will only be attacked by one enemy at a time.

waves.title: Sorcery Only
waves.description: Fight against sorcerers of this faction.
